      <div style="text-align: left; font-size: 10pt;"> <br/>
      </div>

      <div style="text-align: left; font-size: 10pt;">
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">Indicate by check mark whether the Registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405 of this chapter) or Rule 12b-2 of the
          Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2 of this chapter).</div>

      </div>

      <div><br/>
      </div>

      <div style="text-align: right; font-size: 10pt;">Emerging growth company &#160; &#160; <ix:nonNumeric name="dei:EntityEmergingGrowthCompany" id="Fact_664667862ea2427c888ff194e1a6d1d5" contextRef="c20240503to20240503" format="ixt-sec:boolballotbox">&#9744;</ix:nonNumeric></div>

      <div><br/>
      </div>

      <div style="text-align: left; font-size: 10pt;">
        <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the Registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial
          accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744;</div>

        <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"> <br/>
        </div>

      </div>

      <div style="margin-top: 6pt;">
        <hr style="border: none; border-bottom: 4px solid black; border-top: 1px solid black; height: 10px; color: #ffffff; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: center; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;"/> </div>

    </div>

  </div>

      <hr style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"/></div>

  <div>
    <div>
      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;">


  <tr style="vertical-align: top;">

    <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 54pt;">
              <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;">Item 7.01</div>
            </td>

    <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
              <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;">Regulation FD Disclosure.</div>
            </td>

  </tr>


</table>
    </div>

    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">On April 23, 2024, the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California (the &#8220;District Court&#8221;) issued an order granting preliminary approval of the proposed settlement of
      the consolidated derivative lawsuits captioned <span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</span>, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153-YGR (N.D. Cal.) and <span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</span>, Lead Case No. 19CV355213 (Cal. Super. Ct., Santa Clara County), and other potential related derivative claims. </div>

    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">As required by the District Court&#8217;s order, copies of (i) the Notice of Pendency and Proposed Settlement of Shareholder Derivative Actions, and (ii) the Amended Stipulation and
        Agreement of Compromise, Settlement, and Release (and the exhibits attached thereto) are attached hereto as Exhibits 99.1 and 99.2, respectively. The information contained in this Current Report, including Exhibits 99.1 and 99.2, shall not be
        deemed &#8220;filed&#8221; for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;), or incorporated by reference in any filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, except as shall be
        expressly set forth by specific reference in such a filing. </div>

    </div>

    <div>&#160;</div>

      <div>
        <div style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;"><u>NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</u></div>
        <div style="text-align: center;">&#160;</div>
        <div style="text-align: center; font-style: italic; font-weight: bold;"><u>A Federal Court authorized this Notice. This is not a solicitation from a lawyer.</u></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-weight: bold;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">TO:</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="font-weight: bold;">ALL PERSONS OR ENTITIES WHO OR WHICH HELD SHARES OF APPLE INC. (&#8220;APPLE&#8221; OR THE &#8220;COMPANY&#8221;) COMMON STOCK AS OF
            THE CLOSE OF</font> TRADING ON APRIL 29, 2024.</div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-weight: bold;"> <br>
        </div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;">The purpose of this Notice is to inform you of: (i) the pendency of the shareholder derivative action brought on behalf of Apple Inc. (&#8220;Apple&#8221; or the &#8220;Company&#8221;) styled as <font style="font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</font>, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153-YGR (the &#8220;Federal Action&#8221;), pending in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, Oakland Division (the
          &#8220;Federal Court&#8221;), the stockholder derivative action brought on behalf of Apple pending in the Superior Court of the State of California, County of Santa Clara (the &#8220;California Court&#8221;), styled as <font style="font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc.
            Stockholder Derivative Litigation</font>, Lead Case No. 19CV355213 (the &#8220;California Action&#8221;), and a factually-related litigation demand on Apple&#8217;s board of directors (the &#8220;Demand&#8221; and, together with the Federal Action and California Action, the
          &#8220;Actions&#8221;); (ii) a proposed settlement of the Actions (the &#8220;Settlement&#8221;), subject to approval of the Federal Court, as provided in the Amended Stipulation and Agreement of Compromise, Settlement, and Release dated as of April 29, 2024 (the
          &#8220;Stipulation&#8221;); (iii) the hearing that the Federal Court will hold on July 16, 2024 at 2:00 p.m. to determine whether to approve the proposed Settlement and the agreed-to Fee and Expense Amount to all Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel;<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1&#160;</sup>as well as Service Awards to Plaintiffs; and (iv) Current Apple Shareholders&#8217; rights with respect to the proposed Settlement and the Fee and Expense Amount.<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
        <div style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">PLEASE READ THIS NOTICE CAREFULLY AND IN ITS ENTIRETY. </div>
        <div style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">YOUR RIGHTS WILL BE AFFECTED BY THE PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF THIS ACTION.</div>
        <div style="text-align: justify;"><br>
        </div>
        <div style="text-align: justify;">
          <hr noshade="noshade" align="left" style="height: 2px; width: 20%; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; border: none;"></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify;"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1</sup> &#8220;Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel&#8221; consist of the law firms of Robbins LLP, Weiss Law LLP, Glancy Prongay &amp; Murray LLP, Herman Jones LLP,
          The Mehdi Firm, PC, and Purcell &amp; Lefkowitz LLP. Robbins LLP and Weiss Law LLP are &#8220;Plaintiffs&#8217; Co-Lead Counsel&#8221; in the Federal Action.</div>
        <div style="text-align: justify;"> <br>
        </div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2 </sup>All capitalized terms not otherwise defined in this Notice shall have the meaning
            provided in the Stipulation, which is available at the &#8220;Investor Relations&#8221; section of the Company&#8217;s website,<u> investor.apple.com</u>.</font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
          <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zaa11b4af0e704d268460a28fd014fd13">

                <tr>
                  <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 1 -</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                    <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>
          </div>
          <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
        </div>
        <div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 12pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;">The Stipulation was entered into as of April 29, 2024, between and among (i) plaintiffs in the Federal Action, Terrence Zehrer, derivatively on
              behalf of Apple; Andrew Fine, Tammy Federman SEP/IRA, and The Rosenfeld Family Foundation, derivatively on behalf of Apple; and John Votto, derivatively on behalf of Apple (collectively, the &#8220;Federal Plaintiffs&#8221;); (ii) plaintiffs in the
              California Action, Tim Himstreet, derivatively on behalf of Apple; and Steven Hill, derivatively on behalf of Apple (collectively, the &#8220;California Plaintiffs&#8221;); (iii) Apple shareholders Augustin Sacks and Gerard Bernales, who made a
              litigation demand on Apple&#8217;s board of directors (the &#8220;Demanding Shareholders,&#8221; and collectively with the Federal Plaintiffs and California Plaintiffs, the &#8220;Plaintiffs&#8221;); (iv) current and former defendants in the Federal Action and/or the
              California Action: Timothy D. Cook; Luca Maestri; Craig Federighi; Arthur D. Levinson; Albert Gore, Jr.; Andrea Jung; James A. Bell; Ronald D. Sugar; Robert A. Iger; and Susan L. Wagner (collectively, &#8220;Defendants&#8221;); and (v) Apple (Apple,
              Plaintiffs, Demanding Shareholders and Defendants are collectively referred to as the &#8220;Parties&#8221;), subject to the approval of the Federal Court pursuant to Rule 23.1 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.</font></div>
          <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;">As described on pages 6-10 below, the Settlement provides for certain corporate governance reforms that Apple has agreed to adopt, implement, and/or maintain in connection with the Settlement.</div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;">&#160;</div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: bold; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>PLEASE NOTE</u>: THERE IS NO PROOF OF CLAIM FORM FOR SHAREHOLDERS TO SUBMIT IN CONNECTION WITH THIS SETTLEMENT, AND
              SHAREHOLDERS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO TAKE ANY ACTION IN RESPONSE TO THIS NOTICE.</font></div>
          <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: bold;"> <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
            </font></div>
          <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" id="zba44b30eb2fd4668a71a89697f58c8b2" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">

              <tr>
                <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                  <div style="text-align: center;">WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THIS NOTICE?</div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
          <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;">The purpose of this Notice is to explain the Actions, the terms of the proposed Settlement, and how the proposed Settlement affects Current Apple Shareholders&#8217; legal rights. </div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
          </div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;">In a derivative action, one or more persons or entities who are current shareholders of a corporation sue on behalf of, and for the benefit of, the corporation, seeking to enforce the
            corporation&#8217;s legal rights. In this case, Plaintiffs have filed suit against Defendants on behalf of, and for the benefit of, Apple. </div>
          <div style="text-align: justify;"> <br>
          </div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;">The Federal Court has scheduled a hearing to consider the fairness, reasonableness, and adequacy of the Settlement and the Fee and Expense Amount and Service Awards (the &#8220;Settlement Fairness
            Hearing&#8221;). <font style="font-style: italic;">See </font>pages 14-16 below for details about the Settlement Fairness Hearing, including the location, date, and time of the hearing.</div>
          <div> <br>
          </div>
          <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z2ead0ba63c064519921797eca9e5003d">

                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 2 -</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                    </td>
                  </tr>

              </table>
            </div>
            <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
              <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></div>
          </div>
          <div>
            <div style="color: #000000;">
              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="ze6e9e229b5764be3b3c6c7f94e3fb95a" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      <div style="text-align: center;">WHAT ARE THESE CASES ABOUT? WHAT HAS HAPPENED SO FAR?</div>
                    </td>
                  </tr>

              </table>
              <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
              <div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">THE FOLLOWING DESCRIPTION OF THE ACTIONS AND THE SETTLEMENT HAS BEEN PREPARED BY COUNSEL FOR THE PARTIES AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE FINDINGS OF THE FEDERAL COURT OR THE CALIFORNIA COURT.
                  IT SHOULD NOT BE UNDERSTOOD AS AN EXPRESSION OF ANY OPINION OF THE COURT AS TO THE MERITS OF ANY OF THE CLAIMS OR DEFENSES RAISED BY ANY OF THE PARTIES OR THE FAIRNESS OR ADEQUACY OF THE PROPOSED SETTLEMENT.</div>
              </div>
              <div><br>
              </div>
              <div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u>FEDERAL COURT PROCEEDINGS</u></div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u> <br>
                  </u></div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On August 19, 2019, an Apple stockholder commenced a stockholder derivative action in Federal Court captioned as <font style="font-style: italic;">Zehrer v. Cook, et
                    al.</font>, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153, (the &#8220;<font style="font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font>Action&#8221;) against defendants Cook, Maestri, Federighi, Levinson, Gore, Jung, Bell, Sugar, Iger, and Wagner alleging, among other things, that
                  Defendants breached their fiduciary duties (i) by causing or allowing the Company to address the effects of aging iPhone batteries by disseminating iOS software updates designed to slow iPhone performance without customer knowledge or
                  consent in violation of consumer protection laws and regulations in domestic and international markets, and (ii) by making false and misleading statements to investors about the effects of aging iPhone batteries on iPhone sales growth and
                  about iPhone demand in the Greater China region.</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On March 11, 2020, the Federal Court entered an order consolidating the <font style="font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font>Action with three other, subsequently-filed
                  actions that asserted similar claims (hereafter, the &#8220;Federal Action&#8221;). On June 29, 2020, the Federal Court appointed Robbins LLP and Weiss Law LLP as Co-Lead Counsel for the Federal Plaintiffs in the Federal Action.</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On August 18, 2020, the Court granted the parties&#8217; stipulation to stay the Federal Action pending resolution of the motion to dismiss the related federal securities
                  class action pending in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, Oakland Division, <font style="font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Securities Litigation</font>, Case No. 4:19-cv-02033-YGR (the &#8220;Federal
                  Securities Action&#8221;), subject to Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; rights to file a consolidated complaint and to seek to inspect the Company&#8217;s books and records pursuant to California Corporations Code section 1601, and to the parties&#8217; obligation to
                  meet and confer regarding Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; participation in any mediation and any discovery conducted in connection with the Federal Securities Action.</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zce7020e02d67483780a7f87a8091b4c1">

                    <tr>
                      <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 3 -</td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                        <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>
              </div>
              <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
            </div>
            <div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On January 25, 2021, following the partial denial of the motion to dismiss the related Federal Securities Action, the Court granted the parties&#8217; stipulation to continue
                the stay of the Federal Action until 30 days following the close of fact discovery in the Federal Securities Action, subject to the Company&#8217;s commitment to participate in a mediation of the derivative claims in the event of any mediation in
                the Federal Securities Action or other action arising from the same or similar facts; designation of the board of directors as constituted on August 19, 2019, as the relevant set of directors for purposes of evaluating Federal Plaintiffs&#8217;
                demand futility allegations; and preservation of Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; right to file a consolidated amended complaint.</div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
              </div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On June 7, August 17, and October 14, 2022, the Court granted the Federal Action parties&#8217; stipulations to continue the stay, subject to substantially similar terms and
                conditions.</div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
              </div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On March 27, 2023, the Court granted the Federal Action parties&#8217; stipulation to set a briefing schedule for Apple&#8217;s motion to dismiss the action under Federal Rule of
                Civil Procedure 23.1.</div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
              </div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On May 24, 2023, the Court granted the parties&#8217; stipulation extending Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; time to complete their ongoing investigation of matters relevant to their
                allegations and to file their consolidated complaint.</div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
              </div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On October 5, 2023, the parties to the Federal Action filed a stipulation advising the Court that they had executed a memorandum of understanding to settle the Action,
                and commenced negotiations regarding a formal stipulation of settlement to be presented for the Court&#8217;s approval.</div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
              </div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u>CALIFORNIA COURT PROCEEDINGS</u></div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
              </div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On September 17, 2019, plaintiff Tim Himstreet filed a derivative action in California Court captioned as <font style="font-style: italic;">Himstreet v. Cook, et al.</font>,
                Case No. 19CV355213 (the &#8220;<font style="font-style: italic;">Himstreet </font>Action&#8221;) asserting claims similar to those raised in the Federal Action. On August 17, 2020, plaintiff Steven Hill filed a derivative action in California Court
                captioned as <font style="font-style: italic;">Hill v. Cook, et al.</font>, 20CV369387 (the &#8220;<font style="font-style: italic;">Hill </font>Action&#8221;), asserting similar claims. On November 16, 2020, the Court entered an order consolidating
                the <font style="font-style: italic;">Himstreet </font>Action and <font style="font-style: italic;">Hill </font>Action (hereafter, the &#8220;California Action&#8221;). Pursuant to the parties&#8217; stipulations, the California Court stayed the
                California Action on terms similar to those in the Federal Action, extending that stay in orders entered on July 1, 2022, October 6, 2022, and March 24, 2023.</div>
              <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
              </div>
              <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                  <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z5f6c3ec7b00440c7b76a6ef7f9676aed">

                      <tr>
                        <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 4 -</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                          <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                        </td>
                      </tr>

                  </table>
                </div>
                <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
              </div>
              <div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u>SHAREHOLDER LITIGATION DEMAND</u></div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On November 13, 2018, the Demanding Shareholders made a litigation demand on Apple&#8217;s board of directors asserting claims similar to those raised in the Federal Action
                  (the &#8220;Demand&#8221;).</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On December 9, 2018, Apple&#8217;s board formed an advisory Demand Evaluation Committee (&#8220;DEC&#8221;) to review and investigate the Demand, with the advice of independent
                  counsel, and report back to the full board concerning its conclusions and recommendations.</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u>THE PARTIES REACHED THE SETTLEMENT THROUGH MEDIATOR FACILITATED ARM&#8217;S-LENGTH NEGOTIATIONS</u></div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">On January 31, 2022, counsel for the Parties participated in a mediation session before Layn Phillips of Phillips ADR (the &#8220;Mediator&#8221;), a nationally recognized
                  mediator with extensive experience mediating complex shareholder disputes similar to the Actions.</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Prior to this first mediation, the plaintiffs in the Federal Action and California Action submitted a mediation statement, made a settlement demand on Defendants, and
                  requested certain documents, which Defendants agreed to provide.</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Parties did not reach an agreement resolving the derivative litigation during the January 31, 2022 mediation session, but agreed to continue their settlement
                  discussions under the aegis of the Mediator.</div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Counsel for the Parties participated in another mediation session before the Mediator on April 6, 2023. At the mediation session, the Parties engaged in discussions
                  regarding the strengths and weaknesses of the claims and defenses at issue. The parties also discussed a range of remedial options and were able to agree on a set of principles and target areas for corporate governance enhancements to be
                  fleshed out through further negotiations. The mediation efforts actively continued telephonically for several months following the April mediation session, during which the Parties exchanged written proposals and counter proposals with
                  the assistance and guidance of the Mediator.</div>
                <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                </div>
                <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z7263bf435f6e43d58068cbe29759ed5c">

                        <tr>
                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 5 -</td>
                        </tr>
                        <tr>
                          <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                            <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                          </td>
                        </tr>

                    </table>
                  </div>
                  <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                    <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                </div>
                <div>
                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Parties ultimately reached an agreement to settle and release all claims asserted in consideration for Apple&#8217;s agreement to adopt, implement, and/or maintain
                    the corporate governance and oversight enhancements as set forth in Exhibit A hereto (the &#8220;Enhancements&#8221;).</div>
                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                  </div>
                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">After reaching agreement on the substantive material terms of the Settlement, the Parties commenced negotiations facilitated by the Mediator regarding reasonable
                    attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses to be paid to Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel, subject to Court approval, in consideration for the substantial benefits conferred upon Apple and its shareholders by the Settlement.</div>
                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                  </div>
                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Stipulation, together with the exhibits hereto, which has been duly executed by the undersigned signatories on behalf of their respective clients, reflects the
                    final and binding agreement by and among the Parties.</div>
                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                  </div>
                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> On April 23, 2024, the Federal Court preliminarily approved the Settlement, authorized this Notice to be provided to Apple shareholders, and scheduled the
                    Settlement Fairness Hearing to consider whether to grant final approval of the Settlement. </div>
                  <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                  </div>
                  <div style="color: #000000;">
                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="z1555b8c2cfd64d9284ab2ac4415ff73c">

                        <tr>
                          <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                            <div style="text-align: center;">WHAT ARE THE TERMS OF THE SETTLEMENT?</div>
                          </td>
                        </tr>

                    </table>
                  </div>
                  <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                  </div>
                  <div style="color: #000000;">
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The full terms and conditions of the Settlement are embodied in the Stipulation, which is on file with the Federal Court. The following is only a summary of the
                      Stipulation.</div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">In consideration of the full settlement and release of the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims (defined below) against the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties (defined below) and
                      the dismissal with prejudice of the Actions, Defendants and Apple have agreed that Apple shall adopt and implement the corporate governance enhancements identified in Exhibit A to the Stipulation in the time and manner specified
                      therein.</div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Board, on behalf of the Company, and in a determination made in the good faith exercise of the Board&#8217;s business judgment, acknowledges and agrees that the
                      filing of, pendency of, and/or settlement demands made in the Actions caused Apple to adopt, implement, and/or maintain the Enhancements. The Board further acknowledges and agrees that (i) the Enhancements confer substantial benefits
                      upon Apple and its shareholders; and (ii) Apple&#8217;s commitment to adopt, implement, and/or maintain the Enhancements will serve Apple and its shareholders&#8217; best interests and constitutes fair, reasonable and adequate consideration for
                      the release of the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims.</div>
                    <br>
                  </div>
                  <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                    <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zb960205efd344422ae296b932db3b621">

                          <tr>
                            <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 6 -</td>
                          </tr>
                          <tr>
                            <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                              <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                            </td>
                          </tr>

                      </table>
                    </div>
                    <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                      <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                  </div>
                  <div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Enhancements provide for:</div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z607df8298598410aad712aa6719e595a" class="DSPFListTable">

                          <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                            <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 27pt;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">1.</div>
                            </td>
                            <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u><font style="font-weight: bold;">Enhanced Risk Oversight</font></u></div>
                            </td>
                          </tr>

                      </table>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                    <div>
                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z0471b4bf476d4062bcc3531c46699e21" class="DSPFListTable">

                          <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                            <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                            <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                            </td>
                            <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Company will amend the Risk Oversight Committee Charter to include a requirement that the Committee review and discuss material regulatory compliance issues relating
                                to the Company&#8217;s products, including risks related to performance, manufacturing defects and safety, and the steps management has taken to monitor and mitigate potential product regulatory compliance risks.</div>
                            </td>
                          </tr>

                      </table>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                    <div>
                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="za936f00231ed4387bb9c51348c719f05" class="DSPFListTable">

                          <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                            <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                            <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                            </td>
                            <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Chief Compliance Officer will become a member of the Risk Oversight Committee, attend the meetings thereof and, if necessary, report to the Audit and Finance Committee
                                on the matters relating to her duties.</div>
                            </td>
                          </tr>

                      </table>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                    <div>
                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z81ef27b61cda45b7a8568143676dc7f8" class="DSPFListTable">

                          <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                            <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                            <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                            </td>
                            <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                <div style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Company will ensure that data (including in-store and third-party repair data, social media and other sources) bearing upon Performance Management<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup> will be actively and regularly monitored, compiled, and made available to leaders on the business teams responsible for product lines, who will evaluate, and, as appropriate,
                                  address or escalate for further review and oversight, real-time trends and issues.</div>
                              </div>
                            </td>
                          </tr>

                      </table>
                    </div>
                    <div><br>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify;">To the extent potentially significant or material business, compliance, financial, reputational or other risks regarding Performance Management are suggested by the frequency of repair and/or
                      replacement events, the leaders on the responsible business teams will consider recommendations for further investigation and evaluation, enhanced customer communication, and/or customer-oriented remedial action;</div>
                    <div><br>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z55a3734c21414ddcbb4a10ab37c28877" class="DSPFListTable">

                          <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                            <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                            <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                            </td>
                            <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Company shall establish a protocol for report evaluation, recommendation, and escalation, as appropriate. The protocol will incorporate the following provisions:</div>
                            </td>
                          </tr>

                      </table>
                    </div>
                    <div><br>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                      <hr noshade="noshade" align="left" style="height: 2px; width: 20%; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; border: none;"></div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3 </sup>For purposes of this Settlement, &#8220;Performance Management&#8221; means dynamically managing performance
                      peaks based in part on the chemical age of an iPhone&#8217;s battery.</div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                    </div>
                    <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                      <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zca7772ca925644ae90f69d959930db4f">

                            <tr>
                              <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 7 -</td>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                              <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                        <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z0d36774177c24182b51c4901e64c6653" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 18pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: left; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">o </div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Upon receipt of reports bearing on Performance Management and the related customer experience, leaders on the business teams responsible for affected product lines shall
                                  evaluate key drivers to determine whether potentially significant or material business, compliance, financial, reputational or other risks warrant further evaluation, escalation, and decision-making, including, but not
                                  limited to, recommendations for further investigation and evaluation, enhanced customer communication, and/or customer-oriented remedial action;</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div>&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z8a90e7a897e34c5296c5ea0adfd154c0" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 18pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: left; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">o </div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">In the event that leaders on the business teams responsible for product lines determine further action may be necessary, they shall prepare a written report reflecting
                                  their evaluation and recommendations. Any further investigation or evaluation deemed necessary shall be undertaken immediately and completed within a reasonable time, and the results considered and included in a final
                                  escalation report, which shall be provided to the Chief Compliance Officer and Chief Operations Officer.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div>&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z4f7ec98483a142139bdf736d337e65c7" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 18pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">o </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Chief Operations Officer (COO), or a person designated by the COO, shall work directly with the relevant business teams to timely develop and implement an action
                                  plan designed to address and resolve or mitigate business, compliance, financial and/or reputational risks arising from product field performance and related customer experience issues.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div>&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z2f3028d5b2bb4990bf1471b6e44b3780" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 18pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">o &#160; </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Where, as referenced above, material regulatory compliance issues relating to Performance Management are found by the relevant business teams to be significant or
                                  potentially material, or other escalation criteria established by the Risk Oversight Committee are met, escalation reports setting out proposed remedial responses shall be prepared by the business teams in conjunction with
                                  the Chief Compliance Officer and timely presented to the Risk Oversight Committee and, as appropriate, senior executives.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div>&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="zf64b0109f8b2433e9e6bf7447607305a" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 18pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: left; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">o</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Risk Oversight Committee shall review and evaluate the proposed remedial response in the escalation report and make any further recommendations as the Committee
                                  deems necessary and appropriate to ensure timely and effective risk management and mitigation.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                    </div>
                    <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                      <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z49f64f8bbf5d4805833b0dd16973a6ae">

                            <tr>
                              <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 8 -</td>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                              <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                        <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z69ab578982094beaab6ad4674a3d4215" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 27pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">2.</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u><font style="font-weight: bold;">Enhanced Oversight of iOS Update Transparency</font></u></div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z18799c00b6924c88af787391b38ba913" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Before release of an iOS update involving changes to Performance Management, the Chief Compliance Officer will review iPhone release notes on that topic in order to
                                  ensure accurate, timely, and transparent disclosures of such changes.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="za1d23f74f218446791eb06abec1ac313" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Chief Compliance Officer shall work with the appropriate business team leaders to ensure that Apple&#8217;s website appropriately identifies and describes the key
                                  components of such release notes relating to Performance Management.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z383eebb9ce674ef598bd4f2dc3a19cd4" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 27pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">3.</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u><font style="font-weight: bold;">Extension and Expansion of Previously Expired Customer Transparency Commitments</font></u></div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z8b8838c027c0429dbc573cbc084394bd" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Apple shall maintain easily accessible and prominent webpage(s) that provide clear and conspicuous information to consumers about lithium-ion batteries, unexpected
                                  shutdowns, and Performance Management, as defined above. The webpage(s) will provide guidance to consumers on steps they can take to maximize battery health and also describe the operation of Performance Management and its
                                  impact on iPhone battery and performance.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z02d088b73eb24a9baf052b733b9df0f7" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">In the event a future iOS update materially changes the impact of Performance Management, Apple shall notify consumers in a clear and conspicuous manner of those changes
                                  in the installation notes for the update.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z006bdb65963b4cdc906a025179a43aac" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Apple will provide information to consumers in the iPhone user interface about battery health, and will notify consumers of the option to service the battery once the
                                  performance of the battery has become significantly degraded.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="zdd0fde98ea33420f8c4fae638f49c0a4" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Apple will provide its consumer-facing staff with all necessary education and training regarding: (i) the information in the webpage(s) described above; (ii) the iPhone
                                  user interface described above; and (iii) where to find further information on Apple webpage(s) or interface relating to Performance Management.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z26dd8d0f862b4feca90e12a93491e8e0" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Apple&#8217;s General Counsel, on an ad hoc basis, will report to the Audit and Finance Committee on any material compliance issues related to the above commitments</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="ze5cc834939f746768471f01950dcb64f" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 27pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: left; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">4.</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u><font style="font-weight: bold;">Enhanced Investor Disclosure Oversight</font></u></div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                    </div>
                    <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                    </div>
                    <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                      <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z1b07e8167ea34740a215f351c754fd14">

                            <tr>
                              <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 9 -</td>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                              <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                        <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                      <div>
                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="zc4e83e6b4a5e491bbaab74cd0835a7c8" class="DSPFListTable">

                            <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                              <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                              <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#8226;</div>
                              </td>
                              <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Apple will adopt and implement a written policy that requires the co-Chairs of the Disclosure Committee to review transcripts of each earnings call and make appropriate
                                  recommendations, as necessary, with respect to correction, clarification, further disclosure or explanation, or other actions. The adoption of this policy, and any recommendation made and adopted pursuant to it, do not
                                  constitute, and may not be construed as, an admission that any previous statement by any past or present employee, officer, or director of the Company was false or misleading.</div>
                              </td>
                            </tr>

                        </table>
                      </div>
                      <div> <br>
                      </div>
                      <div>
                        <div style="color: #000000;">
                          <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="zc256a58653824776bb5acd70f47632ec">

                              <tr>
                                <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                  <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">WHAT ARE THE PARTIES&#8217; REASONS FOR THE SETTLEMENT?</div>
                                </td>
                              </tr>

                          </table>
                        </div>
                      </div>
                      <div>
                        <div><br>
                        </div>
                        <br>
                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Plaintiffs brought their claims in good faith and continue to believe that their claims have merit but, based upon Plaintiffs&#8217; and Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel&#8217;s
                          investigation and prosecution of the Actions, Plaintiffs and Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel have concluded that the terms and conditions of this Stipulation are fair, reasonable, and adequate, and in the best interests of the Company and its
                          shareholders. Based on Plaintiffs&#8217; oversight of the prosecution of this matter and with the advice of their counsel, Plaintiffs have agreed to settle and release the claims asserted in the Actions pursuant to the terms and
                          provisions of the Stipulation, after considering (a) the substantial benefits conferred upon Apple and its shareholders through the corporate governance protections provided under the proposed Settlement; and (b) the desirability
                          of guaranteeing those benefits by permitting the proposed Settlement to be consummated as provided by the terms of the Stipulation, and avoiding the uncertainties, delays, costs, and substantial risks entailed in further
                          litigation.</div>
                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                        </div>
                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Defendants have denied, and continue to deny, that they committed, or aided and abetted in the commission of, any violation of law or duty or engaged in any
                          wrongful acts whatsoever, including specifically those alleged in the Actions, and expressly maintain that they have complied with their statutory, fiduciary, and other legal duties, and that at all relevant times they acted in
                          good faith and in a manner they reasonably believed to be in the best interests of Apple and its shareholders. Defendants, however, have also taken into account the burden, expense, and uncertainties inherent in further
                          litigation, and have therefore determined that it is in the best interests of the Company for the Actions to be settled in the manner and upon the terms and conditions set forth in the Stipulation.</div>
                        <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                        </div>
                        <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                          <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z76c19734c32643d9932b7d761cb1a825">

                                <tr>
                                  <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 10 -</td>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                  <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                    <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                  </td>
                                </tr>

                            </table>
                          </div>
                          <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                        </div>
                        <div style="color: #000000;">
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Each of the Parties recognizes and acknowledges that the Actions have been initiated, filed, and prosecuted by Plaintiffs in good faith and defended by
                            Defendants in good faith, that the Actions are being voluntarily settled with the advice of counsel, and that the terms of the Settlement are fair, reasonable, and adequate.</div>
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                          </div>
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">In addition, Apple&#8217;s Board, including each of its independent, non-employee directors (including the members of the DEC), advised by outside counsel for the
                            Company, has unanimously approved a resolution reflecting the Board&#8217;s determination, in the good faith exercise of its business judgment, that the Settlement confers substantial benefits upon Apple and its shareholders, and that
                            the Settlement and each of its terms are fair and reasonable and serve the best interests of Apple and its shareholders.</div>
                        </div>
                        <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                        </div>
                        <div style="color: #000000;">
                          <div>
                            <div style="color: #000000;">
                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="zd2503dcf8e2b4aebbba5164b24c687f2">

                                  <tr>
                                    <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                      <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">WHAT WILL HAPPEN IF THE SETTLEMENT IS APPROVED? WHAT CLAIMS WILL THE SETTLEMENT RELEASE?</div>
                                    </td>
                                  </tr>

                              </table>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                        <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                        </div>
                        <div style="color: #000000;">
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">If the Settlement is approved, the Parties will request that the Federal Court enter a Final Judgment and Order Approving Derivative Action Settlement (the
                            &#8220;Judgment&#8221;). Pursuant to the Judgment, upon the Effective Date of the Settlement, the following releases will occur:</div>
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                          </div>
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">Release of Claims by Plaintiffs, the Company, and the Company&#8217;s Shareholders: </font>Plaintiffs, the Company, and by
                            operation of law the Company&#8217;s shareholders shall be deemed to have, and by operation of law and of the Judgment, shall have, fully, finally, and forever discharged, settled, and released, and shall forever be enjoined from
                            commencing or prosecuting, any and all Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims and Settled Litigation Claims (including Unknown Claims) against the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties.</div>
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                          </div>
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;">&#8220;Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims&#8221; means any and all manner of Claims, including Unknown Claims, that have been or could have been asserted in any forum
                            derivatively or by Apple directly, arising from any act or omission alleged or claims asserted in the Actions; <font style="font-style: italic;">provided, however</font>, that the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims shall not include
                            any Claims arising out of, based upon, or relating to the enforcement of the Settlement. For the avoidance of doubt, the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims do not cover, settle, or release any direct claims held by a Plaintiff as a
                            member of the certified class in the Federal Securities Litigation.</div>
