                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                          </div>
                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;">&#8220;Settled Litigation Claims&#8221; means all Claims against any of the Released Parties, concerning or arising from the commencement, litigation, or settlement of
                            the Claims asserted in the Actions; <font style="font-style: italic;">provided, however</font>, that the Settled Litigation Claims shall not include any Claims arising out of, based upon, or relating to the enforcement of the
                            Settlement.</div>
                          <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                          </div>
                          <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                            <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z0d0c5afaa58e48da892c48e583d62f95">

                                  <tr>
                                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 11 -</td>
                                  </tr>
                                  <tr>
                                    <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                      <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                    </td>
                                  </tr>

                              </table>
                            </div>
                            <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                              <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                          </div>
                          <div style="color: #000000;">
                            <div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 27pt;">&#8220;Unknown Claims&#8221; means any Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims which any Plaintiff, the Company, or any Current Apple Shareholders does not know or suspect to exist in his, her, or its
                              favor at the time of the release of such claims and any Settled Defendants&#8217; Claims which any Defendant, or the Company does not know or suspect to exist in his, her, or its favor at the time of the release of such claims,
                              which, if known by him, her, or it, might have affected his, her, or its decision(s) with respect to this Settlement. With respect to any and all Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims and Settled Defendants&#8217; Claims, the Parties stipulate
                              and agree that, upon the Effective Date of the Settlement, Plaintiffs, Defendants, the Company, and Current Apple Shareholders shall be deemed to have, and by operation of the Judgment shall have, expressly waived any and all
                              provisions, rights, and benefits conferred by any law of any state or territory of the United States, or principle of common law or foreign law, which is similar, comparable, or equivalent to California Civil Code &#167;1542, which
                              provides:</div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify;">
                              <div>&#160;</div>
                            </div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 45pt;">A general release does not extend to claims that the creditor or releasing party does not know or suspect to exist in his or her favor at the time of
                              executing the release and that, if known by him or her, would have materially affected his or her settlement with the debtor or released party.</div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                            </div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;">Any of Plaintiffs, Defendants, Apple, or Current Apple Shareholders may hereafter discover facts in addition to or different from those which he, she, or
                              it now knows or believes to be true with respect to the Settled Claims but, upon the Court&#8217;s entry of the Judgment, Plaintiffs, Defendants, Apple, and each of the Current Apple Shareholders shall be deemed to have, and by
                              operation of the Judgment shall have, fully, finally, and forever settled any and all Settled Claims without regard to the subsequent discovery or existence of such different or additional facts. Plaintiffs, Defendants, and
                              the Company acknowledge that the foregoing waiver was separately bargained for and a key element of the Settlement.</div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                            </div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;">&#8220;Released Defendants&#8217; Parties&#8221; means Defendants, the Company, and any entity in which the Company has a controlling interest, as well as their respective
                              current and former parents, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, agents, successors, predecessors, assigns, assignees, partnerships, partners, committees, joint ventures, trustees, trusts, employees, immediate family
                              members, insurers and reinsurers (in their capacities as such), consultants, experts, and attorneys.</div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                            </div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">Release of Claims by Defendants and the Company: </font>Defendants and the Company shall be deemed to have, and by
                              operation of law and of the Judgment, shall have, fully, finally, and forever discharged, settled, and released, and shall forever be enjoined from commencing or prosecuting, any and all Settled Defendants&#8217; Claims and Settled
                              Litigation Claims (including Unknown Claims) against the Released Plaintiffs&#8217; Parties.</div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                            </div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;">&#8220;Settled Defendants&#8217; Claims&#8221; means all Claims that arise out of or are based upon the commencement, litigation, or settlement of the Actions; <font style="font-style: italic;">provided, however</font>, that the Settled Defendants&#8217; Claims shall not include any Claims arising out of, based upon, or relating to the enforcement of the Settlement.</div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                            </div>
                            <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;">&#8220;Released Plaintiffs&#8217; Parties&#8221; means Plaintiffs, Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel, and any entity in which any Plaintiff has a controlling interest, as well as their
                              respective current and former parents, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, agents, successors, predecessors, assigns, assignees, partnerships, partners, committees, joint ventures, trustees, trusts, employees,
                              immediate family members, insurers and reinsurers (in their capacities as such), consultants, experts, and attorneys.</div>
                            <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                            </div>
                            <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                              <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z46ef3f50bf934c6594ace9caebaec747">

                                    <tr>
                                      <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 12 -</td>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                      <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                        <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                      </td>
                                    </tr>

                                </table>
                              </div>
                              <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                                <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                            </div>
                            <div>
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Within ten (10) calendar days of the Federal Court&#8217;s entry of the Judgment, the parties to the California Action will file a stipulation with the
                                California Court dismissing the California Action with prejudice, and the Demanding Shareholders shall withdraw the Demand with prejudice.</div>
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The &#8220;Effective Date&#8221; of the Settlement will be the first date upon which the following conditions of the Settlement have been met and occurred: (i) the
                                Court has approved the Settlement as described herein, following notice to Current Apple Shareholders and a hearing, and entered the Judgment, and the Judgment has become Final; (ii) the California Action has been dismissed
                                with prejudice; and (iii) the Demand has been withdrawn with prejudice.</div>
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">By Order of the Federal Court, all proceedings in the Federal Action, other than proceedings necessary to carry out or enforce the terms and conditions
                                of the Stipulation, have been stayed until otherwise ordered by the Federal Court. Also, pending final determination of whether the Settlement should be approved, the Federal Court has (i) barred and enjoined the
                                commencement or prosecution of any action asserting any Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims or Settled Litigation Claims against any of the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties; and (b) barred and enjoined the commencement or prosecution of
                                any action asserting any Settled Defendants&#8217; Claims or Settled Litigation Claims against any of the Released Plaintiffs&#8217; Parties.</div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;">
                                <div style="color: #000000;">
                                  <div>
                                    <div style="color: #000000;">
                                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="zbdb1f9ebfd834654bcf96efa292f6623">

                                          <tr>
                                            <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                              <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">HOW WILL THE ATTORNEYS BE PAID?</div>
                                            </td>
                                          </tr>

                                      </table>
                                    </div>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel have not received any payment for their services in pursuing the claims asserted in the Actions, nor have Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel been
                                  reimbursed for their out-of-pocket expenses. Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel invested their own resources for pursuing the claims asserted on a contingency basis; meaning they would only recover their expenses and be compensated for
                                  their time if they conferred substantial benefits upon Apple and its shareholders through this Action. In light of the risks undertaken in pursuing the Actions on a contingency basis and the substantial benefits created
                                  for Apple and its shareholders through the Settlement, the Parties agree that, subject to Court approval, Apple shall pay or cause to be paid attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses to Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel in the agreed amount of
                                  $6,000,000 (the &#8220;Fee and Expense Amount&#8221;).</div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel will apply to the Court for service awards of $5,000 (&#8220;Service Awards&#8221;) to each of the Plaintiffs to be drawn from the Fee and
                                  Expense Amount.</div>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                                <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                  <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z16077d8fb4f7403194a5b7892b0d9637">

                                      <tr>
                                        <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 13 -</td>
                                      </tr>
                                      <tr>
                                        <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                          <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                        </td>
                                      </tr>

                                  </table>
                                </div>
                                <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="color: #000000;">
                                  <div style="color: #000000;">
                                    <div>
                                      <div style="color: #000000;">
                                        <div>
                                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Federal Court will determine whether to approve the Fee and Expense Amount and/or Service Awards. Apple shareholders are not personally
                                            liable for any such fees or expenses or Service Awards.</div>
                                          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                          </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="zd01f0ca5edd840e7a49f56fc817db6a8">

                                            <tr>
                                              <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">WHEN AND WHERE WILL THE SETTLEMENT FAIRNESS HEARING BE HELD? DO I HAVE THE RIGHT TO APPEAR AT THE SETTLEMENT FAIRNESS HEARING? MAY I OBJECT TO THE
                                                  SETTLEMENT AND SPEAK AT THE HEARING IF I DON&#8217;T LIKE THE SETTLEMENT?</div>
                                              </td>
                                            </tr>

                                        </table>
                                      </div>
                                    </div>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">You do not need to attend the Settlement Fairness Hearing. The Federal Court will consider any submission made in accordance with the provisions below
                                  even if you do not attend the hearing. <font style="font-weight: bold;">The date and time of the Settlement Hearing may change without further written notice to Current Apple Shareholders. </font>You should monitor the
                                  Court&#8217;s docket before making plans to attend the Settlement Fairness Hearing. You may also confirm the date and time of the Settlement Fairness Hearing by contacting Federal Plaintiff&#8217;s counsel as indicated on page 16
                                  below.</div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Federal Court will consider the Settlement and all matters related to the Settlement at the Settlement Fairness Hearing. The Settlement Fairness
                                  Hearing will be held on July 16, 2024 at 2:00 p..m., before the Honorable Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers at the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, Oakland Courthouse, Courtroom 1 &#8211; Fourth Floor,
                                  1301 Clay Street, Oakland, CA 94612. At the Settlement Fairness Hearing, the Federal Court will, among other things: (i) determine whether the proposed Settlement on the terms and conditions provided for in the Stipulation
                                  is fair, reasonable, and adequate to Apple and its Current Apple Shareholders, and should be approved; (ii) determine whether the Judgment, substantially in the form attached as Exhibit C to the Stipulation, should be
                                  entered dismissing the Federal Action with prejudice; (iii) determine whether the agreed-to Fee and Expense Amount should be approved; and (iv) consider any other matters that may properly be brought before the Federal
                                  Court in connection with the Settlement.</div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">The Federal Court has reserved the right to adjourn the Settlement Fairness Hearing or any adjournment thereof without further notice of any kind
                                  other than by oral announcement at the Settlement Fairness Hearing or any adjournment thereof. The Federal Court has further reserved the right to approve the Stipulation and the Settlement, at or after the Settlement
                                  Fairness Hearing, with such modifications as may be consented to by the Parties and without further notice to Current Apple Shareholders.</div>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                                <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                  <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z1acd0d100b354086a6db8feb2202e14a">

                                      <tr>
                                        <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 14 -</td>
                                      </tr>
                                      <tr>
                                        <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                          <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                        </td>
                                      </tr>

                                  </table>
                                </div>
                                <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Any Current Apple Shareholder who or which continues to own shares of Apple common stock as of July 16, 2024, the date of the Settlement Fairness
                                  Hearing, can ask the Federal Court to deny approval of the Settlement by filing an objection. You cannot ask the Court to order a larger or different settlement; the Court can only approve or deny the proposed Settlement.
                                  If the Federal Court denies approval, the Company will not be required to implement the corporate governance reforms that Apple has agreed to in connection with the Settlement, and the lawsuit will continue. If that is
                                  what you want to happen, you must object.</div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Current Apple Shareholders may object to the proposed Settlement or the Fee and Expense Amount or Service Awards in writing. As described further
                                  below, Current Apple Shareholders may also appear at the Settlement Fairness Hearing, either in person or through their own attorney. If you appear through your own attorney, you are responsible for paying that attorney.
                                  Your objection and supporting papers must clearly identify the case name and case number, <font style="font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</font>, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153-YGR. You must
                                  file any written objection, together with copies of all other papers and briefs supporting the objection, by mailing them to the Office of the Clerk of the Court, United States District Court for the Northern District of
                                  California, Oakland Division, at the address set forth below, or by filing them in person at any location of the United States District Court for the Northern District of California. Any objections must be <font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic;">filed on or before July 2, 2024.</font></div>
                                <div style="color: #000000;"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic;"> <br>
                                  </font></div>
                                <font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic;"> </font>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><u>Clerk&#8217;s Office:</u></div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">United States District Court</div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Northern District of California</div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Clerk of the Court</div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Oakland Division</div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">1301 Clay Street</div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Oakland, CA 94612</div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="color: #000000;">
                                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">All written objections and supporting papers must also be served to each of the following Parties&#8217; counsel so that they are <font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic;">received on or before July 2, 2024</font>:</div>
                                  <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                                  <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zf9fde1dbb9224c2b9e67cb1d6e1f1c76">

                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 15 -</td>
                                        </tr>
                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">

                                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">405 Howard Street</div>

                              </div>
                              <div style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-left: 27pt;">
                                <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" id="zc24cabb95a1c401dbe002f0761c68c34" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

                                    <tr>
                                      <td style="width: 50%; vertical-align: top;">
                                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">David C. Katz</div>
                                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">WeissLaw LLP</div>
                                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">305 Broadway, 7th Floor</div>
                                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">New York, NY 10007</div>
                                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Telephone: (212) 682-3025</div>
                                        <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">dkatz@weisslawllp.com</div>
                                      </td>
                                      <td style="width: 50%; vertical-align: top; text-align: justify;">&#160;</td>
                                    </tr>

                                </table>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                              </div>
                              <div style="color: #000000;">
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Any objections, filings, and other submissions must: (i) clearly identify the case name and case number, <font style="font-style: italic;">In re
                                    Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</font>, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153-YGR; (ii) state the name, address, and telephone number of the objector and must be signed by the objector; (iii) state whether the objector is
                                  represented by counsel and, if so, the name, address, and telephone number of his, her, or its counsel; (iv) contain a specific, written statement of the objection(s) and the specific reason(s) for the objection(s),
                                  including any legal and evidentiary support the objector wishes to bring to the Court&#8217;s attention, and if the objector indicates that he, she, or it intends to appear at the Settlement Fairness Hearing, the identity of any
                                  witnesses the objector may call to testify and any exhibits the objector intends to introduce into evidence at the hearing; and (v) include documentation sufficient to prove that the objector owned shares of Apple common
                                  stock as of the close of trading on April 29, 2024 and continues to hold Apple stock continuously through the date of the Settlement Fairness hearing.</div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Current Apple Shareholders may file a written objection without having to appear at the Settlement Fairness Hearing. You may not, however, appear at
                                  the Settlement Fairness Hearing to present your objection unless you first file a written objection in accordance with the procedures described above, unless the Federal Court orders otherwise.</div>
                                <div style="color: #000000;"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                                  <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zf21d673256af46e4be51fd3f5acadc90">

                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- 16 -</td>
                                        </tr>
                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                            <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                          </td>
                                        </tr>

                                    </table>
                                  </div>
                                  <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                                    <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                </div>
                                <!--PROfilePageNumberReset%Num%17%- % -%-->
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Current Apple Shareholders who or which file and serve a timely written objection and wish to be heard orally at the Settlement Fairness Hearing in
                                  opposition to the approval of the Settlement or the Fee and Expense Amount or Service Awards, must also mail a notice of appearance to the Office of the Clerk of the Court, United States District Court for the Northern
                                  District of California, Oakland Division, at the address set forth above, or file it in person at any location of the United States District Court for the Northern District of California. Any notice of appearance must be <font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic;">filed or postmarked on or before July 2, 2024</font>. Current Apple Shareholders who or which intend to object and desire to present evidence at the Settlement Fairness
                                  Hearing must include in their written objection or notice of appearance the identity of any witnesses they may call to testify and exhibits they intend to introduce into evidence at the hearing. Such persons may be heard
                                  orally at the discretion of the Federal Court.</div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                </div>
                                <div>
                                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">You are not required to hire an attorney to represent you in making written objections or in appearing at the Settlement Fairness Hearing. However,
                                    if you decide to hire an attorney, it will be at your own expense.</div>
                                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <br>
                                  </div>
                                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;">Unless the Federal Court orders otherwise, any Current Apple Shareholder who or which does not make his, her, or its objection in the manner set
                                    forth above will: (i) be deemed to have waived and forfeited his, her, or its right to object to any aspect of the proposed Settlement, including the Fee and Expense Amount and Service Awards; (ii) be forever barred and
                                    foreclosed from objecting to the fairness, reasonableness, or adequacy of the Settlement, the Judgment to be entered approving the Settlement, or the Fee and Expense Amount or Service Awards; and (iii) be deemed to have
                                    waived and be forever barred and foreclosed from being heard, in this or any other proceeding, with respect to any matters concerning the Settlement or the Fee and Expense Amount or Service Awards; but shall otherwise be
                                    bound by the Judgment to be entered, and the Releases to be given by the Settlement.</div>
                                  <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                  </div>
                                  <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                                    <div id="BRPFPageFooter">
                                      <div>
                                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zc5e1f1e4c8bc4fedab8bfd1f75c38083">

                                            <tr>
                                              <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;"><font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- 17 -</font></td>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                              <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt;">NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>

                                            <tr>
                                              <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">

                                        <div>
                                          <div>
                                            <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;">This Notice summarizes the proposed Settlement. For the precise terms and conditions of the Settlement, please see the Stipulation available at the &#8220;Investor
                                              Relations&#8221; section of Apple&#8217;s website, <u>investor.apple.com</u>. You may also view a copy of the Stipulation by accessing the Court docket in the Federal Action, for a fee, through the Court&#8217;s
                                              Public Access to Court Electronic Records (PACER) system at https://ecf.cand.uscourts.gov, or by visiting the Office of the Clerk of the Court, United States District Court for the Northern District of
                                              California, Oakland Courthouse, 1301 Clay Street, Oakland, CA 94612, between 9:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, excluding Court holidays. If you have questions regarding the Actions or the
                                              Settlement, you may write, call, or email Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; counsel: Craig W. Smith, Robbins LLP, 5060 Shoreham Place, Suite 300, San Diego, CA 92122, 619-525-3990, cmith@robbinsllp.com, or David C. Katz,
                                              Weiss Law LLP, 305 Broadway, 7th Floor New York, NY 10007, 212-682-3025, dkatz@weisslawllp.com.</div>
                                            <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                            </div>
                                            <div style="text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold;">PLEASE DO NOT TELEPHONE THE COURT OR THE OFFICE OF THE CLERK OF THE COURT TO INQUIRE ABOUT THIS SETTLEMENT</div>
                                            <div style="color: #000000; font-weight: bold;"> <br>
                                            </div>
                                            <div style="color: #000000; font-weight: bold;">

                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> Northern District of California,</div>

      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">Telephone: (619) 525-3990</div>
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">Facsimile: (619) 525-399</div>
      <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"> <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>

      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">WEISS LAW LLP</div>
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">Joel E. Elkins</div>
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">jelkins@weisslawllp.com</div>
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">David C. Katz (admitted <font style="font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Pro Hac Vice</font>)</div>
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">dkatz@weisslawllp.com</div>
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">1500 Broadway, 16th Floor</div>

      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">Telephone: (212) 682-3025</div>
      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">Facsimile: (212) 682-3010</div>
      <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-style: normal;"> <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>

      <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-style: italic;">Co-Lead Counsel for Federal Plaintiffs</div>
      <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT</div>
      <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">NORTHERN DISTRICT OF CALIFORNIA</div>
      <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">OAKLAND DIVISION</div>

      <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
      </font>
      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" id="z4a87ff5d51154fdd8267995b61afe155" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

          <tr>
            <td style="width: 50%; vertical-align: top; border-right: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0); border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 10pt;">
              <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial;">IN RE APPLE INC. STOCKHOLDER DERIVATIVE LITIGATION</div>
            </td>
            <td style="width: 50%; vertical-align: top; border-left: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 10pt;">
              <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; margin-left: 9pt; font-size: 10pt;">Case No. 4:19-cv-05153-YGR</div>
              <div style="margin-left: 9pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify;">&#160;</div>
              <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-weight: bold; margin-left: 9pt; font-size: 10pt;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
      <div> <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
        </font></div>
    </div>
    <div style="text-align: left; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 400;"><br>
      <font style="font-size: 10pt;"> </font>
      <div>
        <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
          <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
            <div>
              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 1 - -</font></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                    </td>
                  </tr>

              </table>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
          <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
        </div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">This Amended Stipulation and Agreement of Compromise, Settlement, and Release dated as of April 29, 2024 (the &#8220;Stipulation&#8221;), is entered into by and among (a)
          plaintiffs and intervening plaintiffs in the above-captioned stockholder derivative action (the &#8220;Federal Action&#8221;) pending in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, Oakland Division (the<font style="font-family: Arial;">&#8220;Federal Court&#8221;), styled as </font><font style="font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</font><font style="font-family: Arial;">, Case No. 4:19-cv-</font>05153-YGR: Terrence Zehrer,
          derivatively on behalf of Apple Inc. (&#8220;Apple&#8221;); Andrew Fine,<font style="font-family: Arial;"> Tammy Federman SEP/IRA, and The Rosenfeld Family Foundation, derivatively on behalf of Apple; and John Votto, derivatively on behalf of Apple
            (collectively, the &#8220;Federal Plaintiffs&#8221;); (b) plaintiffs in the stockholder derivative action pending in the Superior Court of the State of California, County of Santa Clara (the &#8220;California Court&#8221;), styled as </font><font style="font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</font><font style="font-family: Arial;">, Lead Case No. 19CV355213 (the &#8220;California Action&#8221;): Tim Himstreet, derivatively on behalf of Apple; and Steven Hill,
            derivatively on behalf of Apple (collectively, the &#8220;California Plaintiffs&#8221;); (c) Apple shareholders Augustin Sacks and Gerard Bernales, who made a litigation demand on Apple&#8217;s board of directors (the &#8220;Demanding Shareholders&#8221; and, together with
            the Federal Plaintiffs and California Plaintiffs, &#8220;Plaintiffs&#8221;); (d) defendants in the Federal Action and/or&#160; the&#160; California&#160; Action:&#160; Timothy&#160; D.&#160; Cook;&#160; Luca&#160; Maestri;&#160; Craig&#160; Federighi;&#160; Arthur D. Levinson; Albert Gore, Jr.; Andrea Jung;
            James A. Bell; Ronald D. Sugar; Robert A. Iger; and Susan&#160; L.&#160; Wagner&#160; (collectively,&#160; &#8220;Defendants&#8221;);&#160; and&#160; (e)&#160; nominal&#160; defendant&#160; Apple (&#8220;Nominal Defendant,&#8221;&#160; &#8220;Apple,&#8221;&#160; or&#160; the&#160; &#8220;Company&#8221;&#160; and,&#160; together&#160; with&#160; Plaintiffs&#160; and&#160; Defendants,&#160;
            the &#8220;Parties&#8221;), by and through their respective undersigned counsel.&#160; This Stipulation supersedes, and renders null and void, the Stipulation of Settlement dated February 8, 2024. Subject to the approval of the Federal Court and the terms and
            conditions expressly provided herein, this Stipulation is intended to fully, finally, and forever settle the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims as against the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties, as those capitalized terms are defined below.<u></u></font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"><u> <br>
            </u></font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"><u>FEDERAL COURT PROCEEDINGS</u> </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">WHEREAS, on August 19, 2019, an Apple stockholder commenced a stockholder derivative action in Federal
            Court captioned as </font><font style="font-family: Arial; font-style: italic; font-size: 10pt;">Zehrer v. Cook, et al.</font><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153 (the &#8220;</font><font style="font-family: Arial; font-style: italic; font-size: 10pt;">Zehrer </font><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">Action&#8221;) against defendants Cook, Maestri, Federighi, Levinson, Gore, Jung, Bell, Sugar, Iger, and Wagner alleging, among other
            things, that Defendants breached their fiduciary duties (i) by causing or allowing the Company to address the effects of aging iPhone batteries by disseminating iOS software updates designed to slow iPhone performance without customer knowledge
            or consent in violation of consumer protection laws and regulations in domestic and international markets, and (ii) by making false and misleading statements to investors about the effects of aging iPhone batteries on iPhone sales growth and
            about iPhone demand in the Greater China region; </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
          <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
            <div>
              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 2 - -</font></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                    </td>
                  </tr>

              </table>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
          <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
        </div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on September 20, 2019, plaintiffs Andrew Fine, Tammy Federman SEP/IRA, and The Rosenfeld Family
            Foundation, commenced a derivative action in Federal Court captioned as </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Fine, et al. v. Cook, et al.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">, Case
            No. 4:9-cv-05863 (the &#8220;</font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Fine </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action&#8221;) asserting claims similar to the </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action, as well as claims for violation of the federal securities laws, based on the same facts and circumstances alleged in the </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action; </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on September 20, 2019, plaintiff Alan Bankhalter commenced a derivative action in Federal Court
            captioned as </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Bankhalter v. Cook, et al.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">, Case No. 4:19-cv-05881 (the &#8220;</font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Bankhalter </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action&#8221;) asserting claims similar to the </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action, as well as claims for violation of the federal securities laws, based on the same facts and circumstances alleged in the </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action; </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on September 20, 2019, plaintiff John Votto commenced a derivative action in Federal Court
            captioned as </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Votto v. Cook, et al.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">, Case No. 4:19-cv-08246 (the &#8220;</font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Votto </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action&#8221;) asserting claims similar to the <u>Zehrer</u> Action, as well as claims for violation of the federal securities laws, based on
            the same facts and circumstances alleged in the </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action; </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on March 6, 2020, the parties filed a stipulation to consolidate the </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action, </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Fine </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action, </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Bankhalter </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action, and </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Votto </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action and to appoint lead counsel;&#160;</font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">
          <div style="text-align: justify; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;">WHEREAS, on March 11, 2020, the Federal Court entered an order relating the <font style="font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font>Action, <font style="font-style: italic;">Fine </font>Action, <font style="font-style: italic;">Bankhalter </font>Action, and <font style="font-style: italic;">Votto </font>Action and consolidating the actions (hereafter, the &#8220;Federal Action&#8221;);</div>
          <font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on April 14, 2020, Bankhalter filed a motion to appoint Pritzker Levine LLP and Gainey McKenna &amp; Egleston as
            interim co-lead counsel; </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on April 14, 2020, plaintiffs Terrence Zehrer, Andrew Fine, Tammy Federman SEP/IRA, and The Rosenfeld Family
            Foundation filed a motion to appoint Robbins LLP and Weiss Law LLP as co-lead counsel for all derivative plaintiffs in the Federal Action (&#8220;Lead Counsel Motion&#8221;); </font></div>
        <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
          </font></div>
        <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
          <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
            <div>
              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 3 - -</font></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                    </td>
                  </tr>

              </table>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
          <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
        </div>
        <div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on June 29, 2020, following briefing on the competing lead counsel motions, the Federal Court granted plaintiffs
              Terrence Zehrer, Andrew Fine, Tammy Federman SEP/IRA, and The Rosenfeld Family Foundation&#8217;s Lead Counsel Motion; </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
            </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on July 1, 2020, plaintiff Bankhalter filed a notice for voluntary dismissal of the </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">Bankhalter </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">Action, which the Federal Court granted on July 6, 2020; </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
            </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on August 11, 2020, the parties to the Federal Action filed a stipulation and proposed order to
              stay the Federal Action pending resolution of the motion to dismiss the related federal securities class action pending in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, Oakland Division, </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Securities Litigation</font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">, Case No. 4:19-cv-02033- YGR (the &#8220;Federal Securities Action&#8221;), subject to
              Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; rights to file a consolidated complaint&#160; and&#160; to&#160; seek&#160; to&#160; inspect&#160; the&#160; Company&#8217;s&#160; books&#160; and&#160; records&#160; pursuant&#160; to California Corporations Code section 1601, and to the parties&#8217; obligation to meet and confer regarding
              Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; participation in any mediation and any discovery conducted in connection with the Federal Securities Action, which the Federal Court granted on August 18, 2020; </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
            </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on January 21, 2021, following the partial denial of the motion to dismiss the related Federal Securities Action,
              the parties to the Federal Action filed a stipulation and proposed order to extend the stay of the Federal Action until 30 days following the close of fact discovery in&#160; the&#160; Federal&#160; Securities&#160; Action,&#160; subject&#160; to&#160; the&#160; Company&#8217;s&#160;
              commitment&#160; to&#160; participate&#160; in a mediation of the derivative claims in the event of any mediation in the Federal Securities Action or other action arising from the same or similar facts; designation of the board of directors as constituted
              on August 19, 2019, as the relevant set of directors for purposes of evaluating Federal Plaintiffs&#8217;&#160; demand&#160; futility&#160; allegations;&#160; and&#160; preservation&#160; of&#160; Federal&#160; Plaintiffs&#8217;&#160; right&#160; to&#160; file a consolidated amended complaint, which the
              Federal Court granted on January 25, 2021; </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
            </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">WHEREAS, on May 31, 2022, the parties to the Federal Action filed a stipulation and proposed order to continue the stay of
              the Federal Action subject to substantially similar terms and conditions, which the Federal Court granted on June 7, 2022; </font></div>
          <div style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
            </font></div>
          <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
            <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
              <div>
                <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                    <tr>
                      <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 4 - -</font></td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                        <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                      </td>

                </table>
              </div>
