                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">10.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">The Parties believe the content and
                                      manner of the notice, as set forth in the above paragraph, constitutes adequate and reasonable notice to Current Apple Shareholders pursuant to applicable law and due process.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">11.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">The Company shall undertake the
                                      administrative responsibility for giving notice to Current Apple Shareholders and shall be solely responsible for paying the costs and expenses related to providing notice of the Settlement as set forth herein or as
                                      may otherwise be required by the Court.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">12.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">At least twenty-one (21) days before the
                                      Settlement Fairness Hearing, the Company&#8217;s counsel shall file a declaration or affidavit confirming compliance with the form, manner and timeliness of notice as approved by the Court.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"><u>FINAL APPROVAL; DISMISSAL OF THE ACTIONS</u></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">13.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">This Settlement is conditioned on the
                                      Federal Action and California Action being dismissed with prejudice, and the Demand withdrawn with prejudice.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> <br>
                                  </font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">14.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">Plaintiffs shall move for final approval
                                      of the Settlement in the Federal Action only, to be followed by the voluntary dismissal of the California Action with prejudice.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> <br>
                                  </font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">15.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">If the Settlement contemplated by this
                                      Stipulation is approved by the Court, counsel for Federal Plaintiffs and Defendants&#8217; Counsel shall jointly request that the Court enter the Judgment, substantially in the form attached hereto as Exhibit C, which will
                                      finally approve the Settlement and dismiss the Federal Action with prejudice.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> <br>
                                  </font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">16.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">Within ten (10) calendar days of the
                                      Court&#8217;s entry of the Judgment, the parties to the California Action shall file a stipulation with the California Court seeking the dismissal of the California Action with prejudice, and the Demanding Shareholders shall
                                      withdraw the Demand with prejudice.</font></font></div>
                              </div>
                              <font style="font-size: 10pt;"> </font>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>
                              <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
                                  <div>
                                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 18 - -</font></td>
                                        </tr>
                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                            <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                                          </td>
                                        </tr>

                                    </table>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"><u>ATTORNEYS&#8217; FEES AND EXPENSES</u></div>
                              </div>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">17.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">The Company acknowledges and agrees that
                                      the Settlement confers substantial benefits upon the Company and its shareholders, and that Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel are entitled to reasonable&#160; attorneys&#8217;&#160; fees&#160; and&#160; expenses&#160; in&#160; an&#160; amount&#160; commensurate&#160; with&#160; the&#160;
                                      value&#160; of the Settlement&#8217;s benefits.&#160; The Parties agree that, subject to Court approval, Apple shall pay or cause to be paid attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses to Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel in the agreed amount of $6,000,000 (the
                                      &#8220;Fee and Expense Amount&#8221;).</font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">&#160;</font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">18.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">The Fee and Expense Amount or such other
                                      amount as may be approved by the Court shall constitute final and complete payment for Plaintiffs&#8217; attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses in connection with the Actions.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> <br>
                                  </font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">19.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">The Fee and Expense Amount shall be paid
                                      to an account designated by Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel within forty-five (45) days of entry of a final order and judgment approving the Settlement and fee and expense amount, notwithstanding the existence of any collateral
                                      attacks on the Settlement, including, without limitation, any objections or appeals.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> <br>
                                  </font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">20.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">In the event that the Judgment fails to
                                      become Final as defined in paragraph 1(v) herein or the amount of attorneys&#8217; fees approved is later reduced on appeal or by the Court, then Plaintiffs&#8217;&#160; Counsel&#160; shall be&#160; severally&#160; obligated to&#160; make&#160; appropriate
                                      refunds&#160; or repayments to Apple or its insurers of any attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses previously paid and any interest earned on&#160; the&#160; balance,&#160; as&#160; appropriate,&#160; within&#160; fifteen (15)&#160; business&#160; days&#160; from receiving
                                      notice from Defendants&#8217; Counsel&#160; of written payment instructions.&#160;&#160; In the&#160; event&#160; Plaintiffs&#8217;&#160; Counsel&#160; fails to make such refunds or repayments as provided in this paragraph 20, Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel shall also be
                                      severally obligated to reimburse Apple and/or its insurers of reasonable attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses they incur to enforce this provision and obtain such refunds or repayments.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"> <br>
                                  </font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">21.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">Plaintiffs&#8217;







                                        Counsel shall allocate the Fee and Expense Amount as agreed amongst themselves.&#160;&#160; Defendants, the Company, and their respective counsel shall have no responsibility for, and no liability whatsoever with respect to,
                                        the allocation among Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel of the Fee and Expense Amount. Any dispute regarding the allocation of fees or expenses among Plaintiffs&#8217; </font>&#160;<font style="font-family: Arial;">Counsel shall have no
                                        effect on the Settlement or the Releases. Any allocation disputes will be finally resolved by the Mediator pursuant to expedited arbitral procedures determined by the Mediator. </font></font></font></div>
                              </div>
                              <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                              </div>
                              <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
                                  <div>
                                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 19 - -</font></td>
                                        </tr>
                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                            <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                                          </td>
                                        </tr>

                                    </table>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">22.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="font-family: Arial;">The effectiveness of the
                                      Settlement, the Releases, and the Parties&#8217; obligations under the Settlement (except with respect to the payment of attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses) shall not be conditioned on the resolution of, nor any ruling regarding,
                                      any Fee and Expense Amount.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">23.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="font-family: Arial;">Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel may apply to
                                      the Court for payment of a service award to each of the Plaintiffs in the amount of $5,000 each (&#8220;Service Awards&#8221;), only to be paid upon Court approval, and to be paid solely from, and out of, the Fee and Expense
                                      Amount. The Defendants agree not to oppose any application for payment of the Service Awards.&#160; The failure of the Court to approve the requested Service Awards, in whole or in part, shall have no effect on the
                                      Settlement set forth in this Stipulation. Neither Apple nor any of the Defendants shall be liable for any portion of any Service Award.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"><u>CONDITIONS OF SETTLEMENT AND EFFECT OF TERMINATION</u></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">24.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;">The Effective Date of the Settlement
                                      shall be deemed to occur on the occurrence or waiver of all of the following events:</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 54pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">(a)</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">the
                                        Court has approved the Settlement as described herein, following notice</font> to Current Apple Shareholders and a hearing, and entered the Judgment, substantially in the form set forth in Exhibit C attached hereto,
                                      and the Judgment has become Final;</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 54pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">(b)</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="font-family: Arial;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">the
                                        California Action has been dismissed with prejudice; and </font></font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"> <br>
                                      </font></font></font></div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 54pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial;"><font style="font-family: Arial;">(c)</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the Demand has been withdrawn with prejudice.</font></font></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">25.</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial;">If any of the conditions specified in paragraph 24 are not met, then: (a) the Settlement and the relevant portions of this Stipulation shall be canceled, unless the Parties
                                      mutually agree to proceed with an alternative or modified Stipulation, and execute and submit the alternative or modified Stipulation for Court approval; (b) the Parties shall revert to their respective litigation
                                      positions in the Actions prior to April 1, 2023; (c) the terms and provisions of the Stipulation, with the exception of (i) this paragraph 25, and (ii) paragraphs 20, 26, 36, 44, and 45 hereof, shall have no further
                                      force and effect with respect to the Parties and shall not be used in the Actions or in any other proceeding for any purpose, and the Parties shall proceed in all respects as if this Stipulation had not been entered;
                                      and (d) the Judgment and any other order entered by the Court in accordance with the terms of this Stipulation shall be treated as vacated, </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">nunc






                                      pro tunc</font><font style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;">.</font> </font></font></div>
                              </div>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>
                              <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">

                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"><u>NO ADMISSION OF WRONGDOING</u></div>
                              </div>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">26.&#160;&#160;&#160; Neither this Stipulation (whether or not consummated), including the exhibits hereto, the negotiations leading to the execution
                                  of this Stipulation, nor any proceedings taken pursuant to or in connection with this Stipulation and/or approval of the Settlement (including any arguments proffered in connection therewith):</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 54pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; shall be offered against any of the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties as evidence of, or construed as, or deemed to be evidence of
                                  any presumption, concession, or admission by any of the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties with respect to the truth of any fact alleged by Plaintiffs or the validity of any claim that was or could have been asserted or the
                                  deficiency of any defense that has been or could have been asserted in the Actions or in any other litigation, or of any liability, negligence, fault, violation of law, or other wrongdoing of any kind of any of the
                                  Released Defendants&#8217; Parties, or in any way referred to for any other reason as against any of the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties, in any arbitration proceeding or other civil, criminal, or administrative action or
                                  proceeding, other than such proceedings as may be necessary to effectuate the provisions of this Stipulation;</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 54pt;"><font style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">(</font>b)&#160;&#160;&#160; shall be offered against any of the Released Plaintiffs&#8217; Parties as evidence of, or construed as, or deemed to be evidence of any
                                  presumption, concession, or admission by any of the Released Plaintiffs&#8217; Parties that any of the Released Plaintiffs&#8217; Parties&#8217; claims are without merit, that any of the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties had meritorious
                                  defenses, or that any monetary or non-monetary recovery under the Complaints would not have exceeded the actual recovery or with respect to any liability, negligence, fault, or wrongdoing of any kind, or in any way
                                  referred to for any other reason as against any of the Released Plaintiffs&#8217; Parties, in any<font style="font-family: Arial;">&#160;</font>arbitration proceeding or other civil, criminal, or administrative action or proceeding,
                                  other than such proceedings as may be necessary to effectuate the provisions of this Stipulation; or</div>
                              </div>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>
                              <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
                                  <div>
                                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 21 - -</font></td>
                                        </tr>
                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                            <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                                          </td>
                                        </tr>

                                    </table>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 54pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; shall be construed against any of the Released Parties as an admission, concession, or presumption that the consideration to
                                  be given hereunder represents the amount which could be or would have been recovered after trial; <font style="font-family: Arial; font-style: italic;">provided, however</font>, that if this Stipulation is approved by the
                                  Court, the Parties, the Released Parties, and their respective counsel, may refer to it to effectuate the protections from liability granted hereunder or otherwise to enforce the terms of the Settlement.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: center; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"><u>MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS</u></div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">27.&#160;&#160;&#160; All of the exhibits attached hereto are hereby incorporated by reference as though fully set forth herein. Notwithstanding the
                                  foregoing, in the event that there exists a conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Stipulation and the terms of any exhibit attached hereto, the terms of this Stipulation shall prevail.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">28. &#160;&#160; The Parties intend this Stipulation and the Settlement to be a final and complete resolution of all disputes asserted or which
                                  could be asserted by Plaintiffs against the Released Defendants&#8217; Parties with respect to the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims. Accordingly, the Parties and their counsel agree not to assert in any forum that the Actions were
                                  brought by Plaintiffs or defended by Defendants in bad faith or without a reasonable basis. The Parties agree that each Party and their Counsel have complied with the applicable requirements of good faith litigation and
                                  that no action, allegation, position taken, or filing was undertaken or made in bad faith or in violation of Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure or comparable provision of state law. The Parties agree that the
                                  Settlement Consideration and the other terms of the Settlement were negotiated at arm&#8217;s-length and in good faith by the Parties, and reflect the Settlement that was reached voluntarily after extensive negotiations and
                                  consultation with experienced legal counsel, who were fully competent to assess the strengths and weaknesses of their respective clients&#8217; claims or defenses.</div>
                              </div>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>
                              <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
                                  <div>
                                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 22 - -</font></td>
                                        </tr>
                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                            <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                                          </td>
                                        </tr>

                                    </table>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">29.&#160;&#160; Defendants and their counsel shall retain their right to deny that Defendants committed, or aided and abetted in the commission
                                  of, any violation of law or duty or engaged in any wrongful acts whatsoever, but neither Defendants, the Company, or their respective counsel will, in any statement made to any media representative (whether or not for
                                  attribution), assert that the Actions were commenced or prosecuted in bad faith, nor will they deny that the Actions were commenced and prosecuted in good faith and are being settled voluntarily after consultation with
                                  competent legal counsel. Likewise, Plaintiffs and their counsel shall retain their right to maintain that their claims have merit, but neither Plaintiffs nor their counsel will, in any statement made to any media
                                  representative (whether or not for attribution), assert that the Actions were defended in bad faith, nor will they deny that the Actions were defended in good faith and are being settled voluntarily after consultation with
                                  competent legal counsel. In all events, none of the Parties shall make any accusations of wrongful or actionable conduct by any Party concerning the prosecution, defense, and resolution of the Actions, nor shall they
                                  otherwise suggest that the Settlement constitutes an admission of any claim or defense alleged.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">30.&#160;&#160;&#160; The terms of the Settlement, as reflected in this Stipulation, may not be modified or amended, nor may any of its provisions be
                                  waived, except by a writing signed on behalf of each of the Parties (or their successors-in-interest).</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">31.&#160;&#160;&#160; The headings herein are used for the purpose of convenience only and are not meant to have legal effect.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">32.&#160;&#160;&#160; The administration and consummation of the Settlement as embodied in this Stipulation shall be under the authority of the
                                  Federal Court, and the Federal Court shall retain exclusive jurisdiction for the purpose of implementing and enforcing the terms of this Stipulation.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">33.&#160;&#160;&#160; The waiver by one Party of any breach of this Stipulation by any other Party shall not be deemed a waiver of any other prior or
                                  subsequent breach of this Stipulation.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">34.&#160;&#160;&#160; This Stipulation and its exhibits constitute the entire agreement among the Parties concerning the Settlement and this
                                  Stipulation and its exhibits, and supersede all prior or contemporaneous oral or written agreements, understandings, or representations among the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof. All Parties acknowledge
                                  that no other agreements, representations, warranties, or inducements have been made by any Party concerning this Stipulation or its exhibits other than those contained and memorialized in such documents.</div>
                              </div>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>
                              <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                <div class="BRPFPageFooter" style="width: 100%;">
                                  <div>
                                    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;">

                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;"><font style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">- - 23 - -</font></td>
                                        </tr>
                                        <tr>
                                          <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center; font-size: 8pt; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                            <div style="font-family: Arial; text-align: center;">AMENDED STIPULATION AND AGREEMENT OF COMPROMISE, SETTLEMENT, AND RELEASE</div>
                                          </td>
                                        </tr>

                                    </table>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                  <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                <div class="BRPFPageHeader" style="width: 100%;"></div>
                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">35.&#160; &#160;&#160; The Parties agree that within sixty (60) days of the Effective Date, they will return to the producing party all documents and
                                  other discovery material obtained from such producing party in any manner in connection with the Actions, including all documents produced by any Party whether formally or informally in connection with the mediation
                                  (&#8220;Produced Material&#8221;), or destroy all such Produced Material; provided, however, that the Parties and their counsel shall be entitled to retain all filings, court papers, hearing transcripts, and attorney work product.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">36.&#160;&#160;&#160; Subject to applicable court rules, all designations and agreements made and orders entered during the course of the Actions
                                  relating to the confidentiality of documents or information shall survive this Settlement. Nothing in this Stipulation, or the negotiations relating thereto, is intended to or shall be deemed to constitute a waiver of any
                                  applicable privilege or immunity, including without limitation, the attorney-client privilege, the joint defense privilege, or work product protection.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">37.&#160;&#160;&#160; This Stipulation may be executed in one or more counterparts, including by signature transmitted via facsimile, or by a
                                  .pdf/.tiff image of the signature transmitted via email. All executed counterparts and each of them shall be deemed to be one and the same instrument.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">38.&#160;&#160;&#160; This Stipulation shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the successors and assigns of the Parties, including any and
                                  all Released Parties and any corporation, partnership, or other entity into or with which any Party hereto may merge, consolidate, or reorganize.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">39.&#160;&#160;&#160; The construction, interpretation, operation, effect, and validity of this Stipulation and all documents necessary to effectuate
                                  it shall be governed by the laws of the State of California without regard to conflicts of law rules, except to the extent that federal law requires that federal law govern. The exclusive forum for the adjudication of any
                                  disputes arising under this Stipulation shall be the United States District Court for the Northern District of California. Each Party accepts and consents to jurisdiction and waives any objection to venue in the identified
                                  court.</div>
                              </div>
                              <div><br>
                              </div>

                              </div>
                              <div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">40.&#160;&#160;&#160; All counsel and any other person executing this Stipulation and any of the exhibits hereto, or any related Settlement
                                  documents, warrant and represent that they have the full authority to do so and that they have the authority to take appropriate action required or permitted to be taken pursuant to the Stipulation to effectuate its terms.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">41.&#160;&#160;&#160; Counsel for the Parties agree to cooperate fully with one another in seeking Court approval of the Settlement, as embodied in
                                  this Stipulation, and to use best efforts to promptly agree upon and execute all such other documentation as may be reasonably required to obtain final approval by the Court of the Settlement.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>
                                <div style="text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">42.&#160;&#160;&#160; The Stipulation shall be treated as jointly drafted and will not be construed against any Party as the drafter.</div>
                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                </div>

                                  deemed to have been duly given upon receipt of hand delivery, facsimile, or email transmission, with confirmation of receipt. Notice shall be provided as follows:</div>
