                                                  <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                                    <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                </div>
                                                <!--PROfilePageNumberReset%Num%1%%%-->
                                                <div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"><u>NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</u></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"> <br>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 10pt; font-style: italic; font-weight: bold;"><u>A Federal Court authorized this Notice. This is not a solicitation from a lawyer.</u></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; font-style: italic; font-weight: bold;"><u> <br>
                                                    </u></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">TO:&#160;&#160;&#160; ALL PERSONS OR ENTITIES WHO OR WHICH HELD SHARES OF APPLE INC. (&#8220;APPLE&#8221; OR THE &#8220;COMPANY&#8221;) COMMON STOCK AS OF THE
                                                      CLOSE OF TRADING ON APRIL 29, 2024.</font></div>
                                                </div>
                                                <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;"> <br>
                                                  </font></div>
                                                <div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"> </font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">The purpose of this Notice is to inform you of: (i) the
                                                      pendency of the shareholder derivative action brought on behalf of Apple Inc. (&#8220;Apple&#8221; or the &#8220;Company&#8221;) styled as </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder
                                                      Derivative Litigation</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153-YGR (the &#8220;Federal Action&#8221;), pending in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California,
                                                      Oakland Division (the &#8220;Federal Court&#8221;), the stockholder derivative action brought on behalf of Apple pending in the Superior Court of the State of California, County of Santa Clara (the &#8220;California
                                                      Court&#8221;), styled as </font><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Stockholder Derivative Litigation</font><font style="font-size: 10pt;">, Lead Case No. 19CV355213 (the
                                                      &#8220;California Action&#8221;), and a factually-related litigation demand on Apple&#8217;s board of directors (the &#8220;Demand&#8221; and, together with the Federal Action and California Action, the &#8220;Actions&#8221;); (ii) a proposed
                                                      settlement of the Actions (the &#8220;Settlement&#8221;), subject to approval of the Federal Court, as provided in the Amended Stipulation and Agreement of Compromise, Settlement, and Release dated as of April 29,
                                                      2024 (the &#8220;Stipulation&#8221;); (iii) the hearing that the Federal Court will hold on July 16, 2024 at 2:00 p.m. to determine whether to approve the proposed Settlement and the agreed-to Fee and Expense
                                                      Amount to all Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel;<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1 </sup>as well as Service Awards to Plaintiffs; and (iv) Current Apple Shareholders&#8217; rights
                                                      with respect to the proposed Settlement and the Fee and Expense Amount.<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></font></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">PLEASE READ THIS NOTICE CAREFULLY AND IN ITS ENTIRETY.</font></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;"> YOUR RIGHTS WILL BE AFFECTED BY THE PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF THIS ACTION. </font></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;"> <br>
                                                    </font></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;"> </font>
                                                    <hr noshade="noshade" align="left" style="height: 2px; width: 20%; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; border: none;"></div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1 </sup>&#8220;Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel&#8221; consist of the law firms of Robbins LLP, Weiss
                                                    Law LLP, Glancy Prongay &amp; Murray LLP, Herman Jones LLP, The Mehdi Firm, PC, and Purcell &amp; Lefkowitz LLP. Robbins LLP and Weiss Law LLP are &#8220;Plaintiffs&#8217; Co-Lead Counsel&#8221; in the Federal Action. </div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2 </sup>All capitalized terms not otherwise defined in this Notice shall have
                                                    the meaning provided in the Stipulation, which is available at the &#8220;Investor Relations&#8221; section of the Company&#8217;s website, <u>investor.apple.com.</u> <br>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;">
                                                    <div>&#160;</div>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                                    <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                                      <div>
                                                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="za95fafb5dc9d4341b9f20445bd3221bc">

                                                            <tr>
                                                              <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center;" rowspan="1"><font style="font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">-
                                                                  <font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">1</font> -</font><br>
                                                              </td>
                                                            </tr>
                                                            <tr>
                                                              <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;">EX. B-1 - NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                                              </td>
                                                            </tr>

                                                        </table>
                                                      </div>
                                                    </div>
                                                    <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                                      <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">The Stipulation was entered into as of April 29, 2024, between and among (i) plaintiffs in the Federal Action, Terrence Zehrer,
                                                      derivatively on behalf of Apple; Andrew Fine, Tammy Federman SEP/IRA, and The Rosenfeld Family Foundation, derivatively on behalf of Apple; and John Votto, derivatively on behalf of Apple (collectively,
                                                      the &#8220;Federal Plaintiffs&#8221;); (ii) plaintiffs in the California Action, Tim Himstreet, derivatively on behalf of Apple; and Steven Hill, derivatively on behalf of Apple (collectively, the &#8220;California
                                                      Plaintiffs&#8221;); (iii) Apple shareholders Augustin Sacks and Gerard Bernales, who made a litigation demand on Apple&#8217;s board of directors (the &#8220;Demanding Shareholders,&#8221; and collectively with the Federal
                                                      Plaintiffs and California Plaintiffs, the &#8220;Plaintiffs&#8221;); (iv) current and former defendants in the Federal Action and/or the California Action: Timothy D. Cook; Luca Maestri; Craig Federighi; Arthur D.
                                                      Levinson; Albert Gore, Jr.; Andrea Jung; James A. Bell; Ronald D. Sugar; Robert A. Iger; and Susan L. Wagner (collectively, &#8220;Defendants&#8221;); and (v) Apple (Apple, Plaintiffs, Demanding Shareholders and
                                                      Defendants are collectively referred to as the &#8220;Parties&#8221;), subject to the approval of the Federal Court pursuant to Rule 23.1 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.</div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                    </div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> As described on pages 6-10 below, the Settlement provides for certain corporate governance reforms that Apple has agreed to adopt,
                                                      implement, and/or maintain in connection with the Settlement.</div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                    </div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> <font style="font-weight: bold;"><u>PLEASE NOTE</u>: THERE IS NO PROOF OF CLAIM FORM FOR SHAREHOLDERS TO SUBMIT IN CONNECTION WITH
                                                        THIS SETTLEMENT, AND SHAREHOLDERS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO TAKE ANY ACTION IN RESPONSE TO THIS NOTICE.</font>&#160;</div>
                                                    <div style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;</div>
                                                    <div style="font-weight: bold;">
                                                      <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="z635dda5d8d5a49ea910447c9be79d9cd">

                                                          <tr>
                                                            <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                              <div style="text-align: center;">WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THIS NOTICE?</div>
                                                            </td>
                                                          </tr>

                                                      </table>
                                                      <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                                      </font></div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">The purpose of this Notice is to explain the Actions, the terms of the proposed Settlement, and how the proposed Settlement affects
                                                      Current Apple Shareholders&#8217; legal rights. </div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                                    </div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">In a derivative action, one or more persons or entities who are current shareholders of a corporation sue on behalf of, and for the
                                                      benefit of, the corporation, seeking to enforce the corporation&#8217;s legal rights. In this case, Plaintiffs have filed suit against Defendants on behalf of, and for the benefit of, Apple.&#160;</div>
                                                    <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                                    </div>
                                                    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                                      <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                                        <div>
                                                          <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z247dbaedfdb34c55ad479a6da245129a">

                                                              <tr>
                                                                <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center;" rowspan="1"><font style="font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">-
                                                                    <font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">2</font> -</font><br>
                                                                </td>
                                                              </tr>
                                                              <tr>
                                                                <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                  <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;">EX. B-1 - NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                                                </td>
                                                              </tr>

                                                          </table>
                                                        </div>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                                        <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                    </div>
                                                    <div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">The Federal Court has scheduled a hearing to consider the fairness, reasonableness, and adequacy of the Settlement and the Fee and
                                                        Expense Amount and Service Awards (the &#8220;Settlement Fairness Hearing&#8221;). <font style="font-style: italic;">See </font>pages 14-16 below for details about the Settlement Fairness Hearing, including the
                                                        location, date, and time of the hearing.&#160;</div>
                                                      <div style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;</div>
                                                      <div>
                                                        <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="z8f281e535b054d7ba05f35c807ba81ad">

                                                            <tr>
                                                              <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                <div style="text-align: center;">WHAT ARE THESE CASES ABOUT? WHAT HAS HAPPENED SO FAR?</div>
                                                              </td>
                                                            </tr>

                                                        </table>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                                      </font>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;">THE FOLLOWING DESCRIPTION OF THE ACTIONS AND THE SETTLEMENT HAS BEEN PREPARED BY COUNSEL FOR THE PARTIES AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE FINDINGS OF THE
                                                        FEDERAL COURT OR THE CALIFORNIA COURT. IT SHOULD NOT BE UNDERSTOOD AS AN EXPRESSION OF ANY OPINION OF THE COURT AS TO THE MERITS OF ANY OF THE CLAIMS OR DEFENSES RAISED BY ANY OF THE PARTIES OR THE
                                                        FAIRNESS OR ADEQUACY OF THE PROPOSED SETTLEMENT. </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"><u>FEDERAL COURT PROCEEDINGS</u></div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> On August 19, 2019, an Apple stockholder commenced a stockholder derivative action in Federal Court captioned as <font style="font-style: italic;">Zehrer v. Cook, et al.</font>, Case No. 4:19-cv-05153, (the &#8220;<font style="font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font>Action&#8221;) against defendants Cook, Maestri, Federighi,
                                                        Levinson, Gore, Jung, Bell, Sugar, Iger, and Wagner alleging, among other things, that Defendants breached their fiduciary duties (i) by causing or allowing the Company to address the effects of aging
                                                        iPhone batteries by disseminating iOS software updates designed to slow iPhone performance without customer knowledge or consent in violation of consumer protection laws and regulations in domestic
                                                        and international markets, and (ii) by making false and misleading statements to investors about the effects of aging iPhone batteries on iPhone sales growth and about iPhone demand in the Greater
                                                        China region.</div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> On March 11, 2020, the Federal Court entered an order consolidating the <font style="font-style: italic;">Zehrer </font>Action
                                                        with three other, subsequently-filed actions that asserted similar claims (hereafter, the &#8220;Federal Action&#8221;). On June 29, 2020, the Federal Court appointed Robbins LLP and Weiss Law LLP as Co-Lead
                                                        Counsel for the Federal Plaintiffs in the Federal Action.</div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                                        <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zf60b1e3205bb4e88b92ced4b371f6c94">

                                                                <tr>
                                                                  <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center;" rowspan="1"><font style="font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- <font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">3</font> -</font><br>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>
                                                                <tr>
                                                                  <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;">EX. B-1 - NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                                          <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"><font style="font-style: italic;"><font style="font-style: normal;">On August 18, 2020, the Court granted the parties&#8217; stipulation
                                                            to stay the Federal Action pending resolution of the motion to dismiss the related federal securities class action pending in the United States District Court for the Northern District of
                                                            California, Oakland Division, <font style="font-style: italic;">In re Apple Inc. Securities Litigation</font>,</font> </font>Case No. 4:19-cv-02033-YGR (the &#8220;Federal Securities Action&#8221;), subject
                                                        to Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; rights to file a consolidated complaint and to seek to inspect the Company&#8217;s books and records pursuant to California Corporations Code section 1601, and to the parties&#8217;
                                                        obligation to meet and confer regarding Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; participation in any mediation and any discovery conducted in connection with the Federal Securities Action.</div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> On January 25, 2021, following the partial denial of the motion to dismiss the related Federal Securities Action, the Court granted
                                                        the parties&#8217; stipulation to continue the stay of the Federal Action until 30 days following the close of fact discovery in the Federal Securities Action, subject to the Company&#8217;s commitment to
                                                        participate in a mediation of the derivative claims in the event of any mediation in the Federal Securities Action or other action arising from the same or similar facts; designation of the board of
                                                        directors as constituted on August 19, 2019, as the relevant set of directors for purposes of evaluating Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; demand futility allegations; and preservation of Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; right
                                                        to file a consolidated amended complaint.</div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> On June 7, August 17, and October 14, 2022, the Court granted the Federal Action parties&#8217; stipulations to continue the stay,
                                                        subject to substantially similar terms and conditions.</div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> On March 27, 2023, the Court granted the Federal Action parties&#8217; stipulation to set a briefing schedule for Apple&#8217;s motion to
                                                        dismiss the action under Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 23.1. <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">On May 24, 2023, the Court granted the parties&#8217; stipulation extending Federal Plaintiffs&#8217; time to complete their ongoing
                                                        investigation of matters relevant to their allegations and to file their consolidated complaint.</div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> On October 5, 2023, the parties to the Federal Action filed a stipulation advising the Court that they had executed a memorandum of
                                                        understanding to settle the Action, and commenced negotiations regarding a formal stipulation of settlement to be presented for the Court&#8217;s approval. </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                                        <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zfa2443e8f3b340d590b9ca4715aa90f6">

                                                                <tr>
                                                                  <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center;" rowspan="1"><font style="font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- <font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">4</font> -</font><br>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>
                                                                <tr>
                                                                  <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;">EX. B-1 - NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                                          <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"><u>CALIFORNIA COURT PROCEEDINGS</u>
                                                        <div style="text-indent: 27pt;"><u> <br>
                                                          </u></div>
                                                        <div style="text-indent: 27pt;">On September 17, 2019, plaintiff Tim Himstreet filed a derivative action in California Court captioned as <font style="font-style: italic;">Himstreet v. Cook, et al.</font>,
                                                          Case No. 19CV355213 (the &#8220;<font style="font-style: italic;">Himstreet </font>Action&#8221;) asserting claims similar to those raised in the Federal Action. On August 17, 2020, plaintiff Steven Hill filed
                                                          a derivative action in California Court captioned as <font style="font-style: italic;">Hill v. Cook, et al.</font>, 20CV369387 (the &#8220;<font style="font-style: italic;">Hill </font>Action&#8221;),
                                                          asserting similar claims. On November 16, 2020, the Court entered an order consolidating the <font style="font-style: italic;">Himstreet </font>Action and <font style="font-style: italic;">Hill </font>Action







                                                          (hereafter, the &#8220;California Action&#8221;). Pursuant to the parties&#8217; stipulations, the California Court stayed the California Action on terms similar to those in the Federal Action, extending that stay in
                                                          orders entered on July 1, 2022, October 6, 2022, and March 24, 2023.</div>
                                                        <div> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div><u> SHAREHOLDER LITIGATION DEMAND<br>
                                                          </u></div>
                                                        <div> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-indent: 27pt;">On November 13, 2018, the Demanding Shareholders made a litigation demand on Apple&#8217;s board of directors asserting claims similar to those raised in the Federal Action
                                                          (the &#8220;Demand&#8221;).</div>
                                                        <div style="text-indent: 27pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-indent: 27pt;">On December 9, 2018, Apple&#8217;s board formed an advisory Demand Evaluation Committee (&#8220;DEC&#8221;) to review and investigate the Demand, with the advice of independent counsel,
                                                          and report back to the full board concerning its conclusions and recommendations. </div>
                                                        <div>
                                                          <div> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <u>THE PARTIES REACHED THE SETTLEMENT THROUGH MEDIATOR FACILITATED ARM&#8217;S-LENGTH NEGOTIATIONS</u><font style="width: 9pt; display: inline-block;" class="HorizontalTab"> <br>
                                                          </font>
                                                          <div><br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-indent: 27pt;">On January 31, 2022, counsel for the Parties participated in a mediation session before Layn Phillips of Phillips ADR (the &#8220;Mediator&#8221;), a nationally recognized
                                                            mediator with extensive experience mediating complex shareholder disputes similar to the Actions.<br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-indent: 27pt;">Prior to this first mediation, the plaintiffs in the Federal Action and California Action submitted a mediation statement, made a settlement demand on Defendants, and
                                                            requested certain documents, which Defendants agreed to provide.</div>
                                                          <div> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-indent: 27pt;"> The Parties did not reach an agreement resolving the derivative litigation during the January 31, 2022 mediation session, but agreed to continue their settlement
                                                            discussions under the aegis of the Mediator.</div>
                                                          <div> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                        </div>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;">
                                                        <div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 27pt;">Counsel for the Parties participated in another mediation session before the Mediator on April 6, 2023. At the mediation session, the Parties engaged
                                                          in discussions regarding the strengths and weaknesses of the claims and defenses at issue. The parties also discussed a range of remedial options and were able to agree on a set of principles and
                                                          target areas for corporate governance enhancements to be fleshed out through further negotiations. The mediation efforts actively continued telephonically for several months following the April
                                                          mediation session, during which the Parties exchanged written proposals and counter proposals with the assistance and guidance of the Mediator.&#160;</div>
                                                        <div>&#160;</div>
                                                        <div style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;" class="BRPFPageBreakArea">
                                                          <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                                            <div>
                                                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zb87433309dae42d59f0c9b1626f53e46">

                                                                  <tr>
                                                                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center;" rowspan="1"><font style="font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- <font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">5</font> -</font><br>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>
                                                                  <tr>
                                                                    <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;">EX. B-1 - NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>

                                                              </table>
                                                            </div>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="page-break-after: always;" class="BRPFPageBreak">
                                                            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                        </div>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">The Parties ultimately reached an agreement to settle and release all claims asserted in consideration for Apple&#8217;s agreement to
                                                          adopt, implement, and/or maintain the corporate governance and oversight enhancements as set forth in Exhibit A hereto (the &#8220;Enhancements&#8221;).</div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> After reaching agreement on the substantive material terms of the Settlement, the Parties commenced negotiations facilitated by
                                                          the Mediator regarding reasonable attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses to be paid to Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel, subject to Court approval, in consideration for the substantial benefits conferred upon Apple and
                                                          its shareholders by the Settlement.<br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">The Stipulation, together with the exhibits hereto, which has been duly executed by the undersigned signatories on behalf of their
                                                          respective clients, reflects the final and binding agreement by and among the Parties.</div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">On April 23, 2024, the Federal Court preliminarily approved the Settlement, authorized this Notice to be provided to Apple
                                                          shareholders, and scheduled the Settlement Fairness Hearing to consider whether to grant final approval of the Settlement.&#160;</div>
                                                        <div style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;</div>
                                                        <div>
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="zdd38ddfcb549476f94d6411fa4bfc50b">

                                                                <tr>
                                                                  <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: center;">WHAT ARE THE TERMS OF THE SETTLEMENT?</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                                        </font>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;">The full terms and conditions of the Settlement are embodied in the Stipulation, which is on file with the Federal Court. The
                                                          following is only a summary of the Stipulation.</div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> In consideration of the full settlement and release of the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims (defined below) against the Released
                                                          Defendants&#8217; Parties (defined below) and the dismissal with prejudice of the Actions, Defendants and Apple have agreed that Apple shall adopt and implement the corporate governance enhancements
                                                          identified in Exhibit A to the Stipulation in the time and manner specified therein.&#160;</div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 27pt;"> The Board, on behalf of the Company, and in a determination made in the good faith exercise of the Board&#8217;s business judgment,
                                                          acknowledges and agrees that the filing of, pendency of, and/or settlement demands made in the Actions caused Apple to adopt, implement, and/or maintain the Enhancements. The Board further
                                                          acknowledges and agrees that (i) the Enhancements confer substantial benefits upon Apple and its shareholders; and (ii) Apple&#8217;s commitment to adopt, implement, and/or maintain the Enhancements will
                                                          serve Apple and its shareholders&#8217; best interests and constitutes fair, reasonable and adequate consideration for the release of the Settled Plaintiffs&#8217; Claims.</div>
                                                        <div style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;</div>
                                                        <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                                          <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                                            <div>
                                                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="zbd7eb3672d884742aaa933d67981ccb5">

                                                                  <tr>
                                                                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center;" rowspan="1"><font style="font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- <font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">6</font> -</font><br>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>
                                                                  <tr>
                                                                    <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;">EX. B-1 - NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>

                                                              </table>
                                                            </div>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                                            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;">The Enhancements provide for:<br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z0bae835e75a5413da1810a93e6d66da6" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                  <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 27pt;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">1.</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;"><u><font style="font-weight: bold;">Enhanced Risk Oversight</font></u></div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"><font style="font-weight: bold;"> <br>
                                                            </font></div>
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z47a955d7fecf4b48a5de96e3e7488b07" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                  <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">&#8226;</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">The Company will amend the Risk Oversight Committee Charter to include a requirement that the Committee review and discuss material regulatory compliance
                                                                      issues relating to the Company&#8217;s products, including risks related to performance, manufacturing defects and safety, and the steps management has taken to monitor and mitigate potential
                                                                      product regulatory compliance risks.</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="zd830f1bf965b4d82b9d7173c6c854773" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                  <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">&#8226;</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">The Chief Compliance Officer will become a member of the Risk Oversight Committee, attend the meetings thereof and, if necessary, report to the Audit and
                                                                      Finance Committee on the matters relating to her duties.</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z6f8edaeeb23743da8ffa635ab5b6b5ae" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                  <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">&#8226;</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">The Company will ensure that data (including in-store and third-party repair data, social media and other sources) bearing upon Performance Management<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup>
                                                                      will be actively and regularly monitored, compiled, and made available to leaders on the business teams responsible for product lines, who will evaluate, and, as appropriate, address or
                                                                      escalate for further review and oversight, real-time trends and issues.</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> To the extent potentially significant or material business, compliance, financial, reputational or other risks regarding Performance Management
                                                            are suggested by the frequency of repair and/or replacement events, the leaders on the responsible business teams will consider recommendations for further investigation and evaluation, enhanced
                                                            customer communication, and/or customer-oriented remedial action;&#160;</div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;">
                                                            <hr noshade="noshade" align="left" style="height: 2px; width: 20%; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; border: none;"></div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup> For purposes of this Settlement, &#8220;Performance
                                                              Management&#8221; means dynamically managing performance peaks based in part on the chemical age of an iPhone&#8217;s battery. </font></div>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <font style="font-size: 10pt;"> </font>
                                                        <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
                                                          <div style="width: 100%;" class="BRPFPageFooter">
                                                            <div>
                                                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; width: 100%;" id="z738a4c61983f4c259e17795d125b59bc">

                                                                  <tr>
                                                                    <td style="width: 100%; text-align: center;" rowspan="1"><font style="font-weight: normal; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 8pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-transform: none;">- <font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">7</font> -</font><br>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>
                                                                  <tr>
                                                                    <td style="width: 100%; border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: center; font-size: 8pt;">EX. B-1 - NOTICE OF PENDENCY AND PROPOSED SETTLEMENT OF SHAREHOLDER DERIVATIVE ACTIONS</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>

                                                              </table>
                                                            </div>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
                                                            <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div>
                                                          <div>
                                                            <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z7a0ba76c7e6f4743b2525d5364b0edec" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                  <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">&#8226;</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                  <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                    <div style="text-align: justify;">The Company shall establish a protocol for report evaluation, recommendation, and escalation, as appropriate. The protocol will incorporate the following
                                                                      provisions:</div>
                                                                  </td>
                                                                </tr>

                                                            </table>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                          </div>
                                                          <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;">
                                                            <div>
                                                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="zc5e0d08bb32048b7ada43221a1a23e8d" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                  <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                    <td style="width: 36pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                    <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: justify;">o</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                    <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: justify;">Upon receipt of reports bearing on Performance Management and the related customer experience, leaders on the business teams responsible for affected
                                                                        product lines shall evaluate key drivers to determine whether potentially significant or material business, compliance, financial, reputational or other risks warrant further
                                                                        evaluation, escalation, and decision-making, including, but not limited to, recommendations for further investigation and evaluation, enhanced customer communication, and/or
                                                                        customer-oriented remedial action;</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>

                                                              </table>
                                                            </div>
                                                            <div> <br>
                                                            </div>
                                                            <div>
                                                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z9c5c5def83fa419ba4304e83b0273778" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                  <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                    <td style="width: 36pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                    <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: justify;">o</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                    <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: justify;">In the event that leaders on the business teams responsible for product lines determine further action may be necessary, they shall prepare a written
                                                                        report reflecting their evaluation and recommendations. Any further investigation or evaluation deemed necessary shall be undertaken immediately and completed within a reasonable time,
                                                                        and the results considered and included in a final escalation report, which shall be provided to the Chief Compliance Officer and Chief Operations Officer.</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>

                                                              </table>
                                                            </div>
                                                            <div> <br>
                                                            </div>
                                                            <div>
                                                              <div>
                                                                <div>
                                                                  <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z95720fb4e8f14414bf4b177066fab470" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                      <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                        <td style="width: 36pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                        <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                          <div style="text-align: justify;">o</div>
                                                                        </td>
                                                                        <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                          <div style="text-align: justify;">The Chief Operations Officer (COO), or a person designated by the COO, shall work directly with the relevant business teams to timely develop and
                                                                            implement an action plan designed to address and resolve or mitigate business, compliance, financial and/or reputational risks arising from product field performance and related
                                                                            customer experience issues.</div>
                                                                        </td>
                                                                      </tr>

                                                                  </table>
                                                                </div>
                                                              </div>
                                                            </div>
                                                            <div> <br>
                                                            </div>

                                                              <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="zc8f736abeb7b425789ecc790cf5d695e" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                                  <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                    <td style="width: 36pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                    <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: justify;">o</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                    <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                      <div style="text-align: justify;">Where, as referenced above, material regulatory compliance issues relating to Performance Management are found by the relevant business teams to be
                                                                        significant or potentially material, or other escalation criteria established by the Risk Oversight Committee are met, escalation reports setting out proposed remedial responses shall
                                                                        be prepared by the business teams in conjunction with the Chief Compliance Officer and timely presented to the Risk Oversight Committee and, as appropriate, senior executives.</div>
                                                                    </td>
                                                                  </tr>

                                                              </table>
                                                            </div>

                                                                </td>
                                                                <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                  <div style="text-align: justify;">The Risk Oversight Committee shall review and evaluate the proposed remedial response in the escalation report and make any further recommendations as the
                                                                    Committee deems necessary and appropriate to ensure timely and effective risk management and mitigation.</div>
                                                                </td>
                                                              </tr>

                                                              <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 27pt;">

                                                                </td>
                                                                <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                  <div style="text-align: justify;"><u><font style="font-weight: bold;">Enhanced Oversight of iOS Update Transparency</font></u></div>
                                                                </td>
                                                              </tr>

                                                          </table>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div>
                                                          <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="zf9bb3f758a1540e6b5e3910a043cc608" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                              <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                  <div style="text-align: justify;">&#8226;</div>
                                                                </td>
                                                                <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                  <div style="text-align: justify;">Before release of an iOS update involving changes to Performance Management, the Chief Compliance Officer will review iPhone release notes on that topic in
                                                                    order to ensure accurate, timely, and transparent disclosures of such changes.</div>
                                                                </td>
                                                              </tr>

                                                          </table>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div>
                                                          <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%;" id="z267e4e51dcac47efb9e25b7d041e871c" class="DSPFListTable">

                                                              <tr style="vertical-align: top;">
                                                                <td style="width: 9pt;">&#160;</td>
                                                                <td style="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; width: 18pt;">
                                                                  <div style="text-align: justify;">&#8226;</div>
                                                                </td>
                                                                <td style="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; width: auto;">
                                                                  <div style="text-align: justify;">The Chief Compliance Officer shall work with the appropriate business team leaders to ensure that Apple&#8217;s website appropriately identifies and describes the
                                                                    key components of such release notes relating to Performance Management.</div>
                                                                </td>
                                                              </tr>

                                                          </table>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div style="text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt;"> <br>
                                                        </div>
                                                        <div>
